    Claims in favor of the estate
        Rd:s
    settled on the 29 August 1828 from S:J: Mostert according to a note of hand dated 15 March 1826 1200:--
    paid the 28 Septb:r 1827 from Harrington and Gadney on a promissory note dated 1 May 1827 1200:--
    settled on the 29 August 1828 from S:J: Mostert according to a note of hand dated 2 January 1827 310:--
    settled with his counter claim paid 12 April 1828 from J:G: Muller according to a note of hand dated 23 February 1827 2382:18
      it is hereby stated that said Muller has a counter claim against said estate of which a specific account will be given by him
      from J:G: Frank van Reenen for the purchase of a bull 100:--
      from Dr Barry for 1000 lbs hay 30:--
      it is hereby further stated that there is an unsettled account between the deceased and his son Dirk Gysbert van Reenen
    Claims against the estate
        Rd:s
      to the estate of the late J:M: Durr according to a bond 11420 or 3806:32
    paid to M: Melk on the 9th May 1828 to J:D: Karnspek according to a bond 7000 or 2333:16
    paid on the 11 February 1828 to the widow H:k Vos according to a bond 26500 or 8833:16
    settled with J:G: Muller to F: Flamme 21000 7000:--
    paid on the 7 August 1828 to the Lombard Bank 6900 or 2300:--
    paid on the 17 February 1828 to the Treasury of the Cape District 3600 1200:--
    in part rd:s1000 with the interest 12 April 1828; redepos: 8000 until the 23 Jan:y 1829 to J:G: Muller 20,000 6666:32
    paid 14 M: 1828 to wid: D: v: Breda 11700 3900:--
    paid to F: Rossouw 2715 905:--
    paid 5 August 1828 to the Discount Bank 4200 1400:--
    interest paid up to 8 February 1828 - 4 March 1828 to E:J: Oliviera 15000 5000:--
      private bond dated 3 February 1826 paid in part 8500 with the intrest thereon from 8 Feb:y last - 3rd June 1828

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope at the place aforesaid on the seventh day of the month of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven according to a statement made by the surviving widow and Rogier Joan Oliviera in the presence of Marthinus Melk and Johan George Muller and Dirk Gysbertus van Reenen G:s son and did the two firstmentioned declare to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowledge they have not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and the said appearers further declared that they are and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm their statement with solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory therewith.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearers and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commissioners: J:F: Munnik, J: Horne, M: Melck, J: George Muller, D:G: v: Reenen G:z

    De weuduwe G: van Reenen, R:J: de Oliviera

    In my presence: J:J:L Smuts

    24 September 1827

    ,en 1 stuk erfpagtland verbanden by de ondervolgende

     
    den boedel van Durr voor 285:10 11420
    J:D: Karnspeck 175:-- 7000
    Bank v: Leening 172:10 6890
    't Kaapsch district 90:-- 3600
    weduwe D:k Vos senior 662:10 26500
    F:N: Flamme 525:-- 21000
    de slavinne Candace of Batavia staat op den inventaris niet opgebragt en is by de Disconto Bank voor 285:10 verbonden

    MOOC8/42.26 1/2¶

        Rd:s
    received in part payment rd:s300 28 Aug:t 1828 from his son Dirk Gysbert van Reenen the purchase money of the loan place calledor 2000
    interest since

    According to his own statement

        Rd:s
    paid Marthinus Melk for Marthina Catharina van Reenen rd:s100 to the two minors Marthina Catharina and Catharina Gesina van Reenen for a bed, bedstead and wardrobe which the other daughters have enjoyed each rd:s100 200
      to Gesina Petronella for a bed, bedstead and wardrobe 100
    paid to Marthinus Melk to Marthina Catharina van Reenen for the purchase of a cow 150
      to R: Oliviera for 4 1/2 moth's super intendance over the farm 150

    on the 25 September1827.

    MOOC8/42.27a¶

    {18200505} 5 May 1820 Petrus Jacobus Maritz

    H: Somerset

    A true and perfect inventory of all and every the goods, chattels, wares and merchandize as well moveable as not, debts, credits and other personal effects of the deceased batchelor Petrus Jacobus Maritz Gert’s son, who died ab intestato at “”,on the 6th day of Nov:r 1825 between the hours of 4 and 5 o’clock a.m. within the field cornetcy of Gert Pet:s Marais, district, and given up as follows

    1 saddle horse
    52 breeding sheep
    Ready cash
    nihil
    Credits in favor of the estate
    From the Orphan Chamber an inheritance the exact amount not known but particularized in the Provincial Inventory bearing date 29th December 1823 submitted to the Orphan Chamber, on the 14th Feb:y 1820
    Debts of the estate
        Rd:s
      n:o 1 to Hendrik Erasmus Smith Alb:s son for the purchase of clothes (residing, dist:t) twenty rix dollars 20
    paid n:o 2 to Jacob Theron Piet's son (residing, dist:t) fifty six rd:s for the purchase of a saddle horse whereof there is a bond dated 15 Aug:t 1825 56
    paid n:o 3 to Pieter Daniel Jacobs (district) the sum of nineteen rix dollars for yellow wood boards for the coffin of the deceased 19
    paid to Mr Baird n:o 4 to Jan Andries Broodryk (district) the sum of twenty five rixdollars for making the coffin of the deceased 25
      Total Rd:s120
    Heirs of the estate
    1) father of the deceased Gert Stephanus Maritz aged 47 years
    2) brother of the deceased Frans Stephanus Maritz Gerts son married to Jacomina Maria du Plessis Dan:l's daughter
    3) sister of the deceased Jacomina Maria Maritz Gert's daughter married to Jacob Theron Piet's son
    4) brother to the deceased Gert Stephanus Maritz Gert's son married to Johanna Coetzee Joh:s Gert's daughter
    5) sister to the deceased Johanna Christina Maritz Gert's daughter married to Dan:l Joh:s Theron Piet's son

    This done and registered on Friday the 5th of May 1820 at the village ofaccording to the statement of Gert Stephanus Maritz father of the deceased, who declares in his above statement of this estate to be done honestly and truly and that nothing has been held back to the best of his judgement and knowledge, and further declares to be always ready (if called upon) to solemnize the same by oath and that he further promises that in the event of any thing further coming to his recollection or knowledge to bind himself to add the same to this inventory.

    Thus done by me the undersigned Dep:y Landdrost in the presence of Christiaan Johannes Rabe and Hartwich Johannes Luttig as witnesses

    For the statement: Gerrit H: Maritz se:r

    As witnesses: C:J: Rabe, H:J: Luttig

    J: Baird, D:y Land:

    MOOC8/42.27b¶

    {18251224} 24 Desember 1825 Petrus Jacobes Maritz

    den 24 Desember 1825

    Invantaris van den nagelaate goederen van den overleijdene Petrus Jacobes Maritz Gerrit zoon die op den sesde Novembir 1825 gestorven is in den ouderdom van twintig jaare drie maande 10 dage door mijn als Veld Cornet benedens de twee onder geteekende getuygen op genome.

    De nagelate goederen

    een rey paard
    drie en vyftig schaape waar onder 25 lammirs is
    Na gelate schult
    betaald aan den burger Jacob Theron P:zoon ses en veytig rijksdaelders
      aan den burger Hendrik Erasmis Smt Abertzoon twintig reijksdaelders voor koope van kleere

    Uitstaande gelt niet gevonde

    De vader van den overleyde Petrus J: Maretz geef op dat beij de Heere Weesmeesteen gelt moet weesen niet weetende hoe veel spruytende van zeijn overleydene moeder Anna Soveija Cloete dogter van Jacob Cloete die benaemt:s heef drie broeders gehaed met name Jasper Cloete, Jan Cloete, Gerrit Cloete Gerrit zoons gewoont beij of aan de. Den over leijdene Jacob Cloete is voor zeijn broeders gestorven en de drie broeders was niet getrout

    Nog schuld gevonde

    betaald van Petrus J:s Maritz G:zoon negentien reijksdaelders aan de heer Pieter D: Jacobs voor planken van zeijn doot kis
      aan de heer Jan Andres Brootreijk veijf en twintig reyksdaelders voor maake van de kist

    Als getuijgen: Matthijs J: Fourie, Jacobus Fr:s van Stade

    G:P: Marais, Veldcornet

    een schroef

    twee zaagen

    drie emmers
    een ketel
    een bak

    drie schotels

    twee yzere potten
    een kan
    drie graven
    een omslag met boren
    een dissel
    twee geweeren waarvan een aan Jacobz is gelaten vermits hetzelve door hem van zynen vader is georven onder voorwaarde dat het geweer nimmer onder vreemden mogt worden verkogt (in gevolge declaratie van gem: Jacobz)
    een ossen wagen compleet
    een ploeg

    Beestiaal
    een hengst
    drie rydpaarden
    vier aanteelpaarden
    tien trek ossen
    vyf en twintig aanteel beesten
    negen honderd twee en veertig aanteel schapen
    vier en vyftig aanteel bokken
    Baten des boedels
      Rd:s
    van J:J: le Roex woonagtig in het district, bl: bewys d:d: 2 November 1826 254
    Schulden des boedels
      Rd:s
    aan de weduwe P: Jacobs geleend 230
    Erfgenamen des boedels
    1) Catharina Geertruida Jacobz geboren 29 July 1810
    2) Martha Johanna Jacobz geboren den 31 January 1814

    Aldus gedaan en geinventariseerd op den 11:e Mei 1827 ter plaatze degelegen in het veld cornetschapvolgens op en aangave van J:P: Jacobz voorm: dewelke betuigde zig in het op en aan aangeeven des voormelden boedels ter goeder trouwe te hebben gedragen en niets met weten verswegen of agter gehouden te hebben alles doende onder aanbod van eede, met verdere belofte zo zig iets nader tot den boedel behoorende mogte komen te ontdekken deezen inventaris daarmede te zullen amplieeren. Ende is zulks geschied door my ond:e Agent der Weeskamer ter presentie van J:J: Meintjes en G:J: Broekhuizen.

    Voor de opgaave: Jehannie Petrus Jacobse

    Als getuigen: J:J: Meintjes, G:J: Broekhuisen

    J:S: Meintjes

    {18240923} 23 September 1824 Frans Walters , Catharina Frederika van der Sandt

    Inventaris van alle zoodanige goederen als behoord hebben tot ten gemeenschappelyke boedel van Frans Walters en desselfs nagelatene weduwe Catharina Frederika van der Sandt en door eerstgem: op den 30 Mey 1824 met er dood ontruimd en nagelaten

    Losse goederen
    1 bed
    2 kussen
    2 bottels
    1 trekpot
    1 zadel
    1 trens
    1 emmer
    1 stoel
    Beestiaal
    1 aanteel paard
    3 aanteel beesten
    61 schaapen
    34 bokken
    Contante
    nihil
    Baaten des boedels
    nihil
    Lasten des boedels
    nihil
    Erfgenamen des boedels
    onbekend

    Aldus geinventarisseerd op de plaatsop den 23 September 1824 volgens op en aangaave van de inde hoofde dezes gemelde weduwe dewelks verklaarde niets met weten verzwegen ofte agtergehouden te hebben met belofte indien zich iets mogte ontdekken tot opgem: boedel behoorende als dan deese inventaris daarmeede te zullen amplieren en zulks des gevordert wordende met solemneele eede nader gestand te doen en is dit alles geschied in presentie van

    Als getuigen: Filip H: Opperman, Coenraad C: Klopper

    Catrina van der Sand die wedu: Walter

    In kennisse van my: C:F: van der Nest, Veldcornet

    MOOC8/42.37¶

    {18271201} 1 December 1827 Sara

    H: Somerset

    A true and perfect inventory of all and every the goods, chatels, wares and merchandize, as well moveable as not, debts, credits and other personal effects of the deceased female Hottentot Sara who died intestate at the place of Albertus Vueselaar on the 23rd August 1827 within the field cornetcy of Mr Jan van der Westhuizen,, district, and given up as follows

    67 sheep
    55 goats
    1 old brass kettle
    1 old leather bag
    1 goat skin
    Ready money
    none
    Credits in favor of the estate
    none
    Debits of the estate
    none
    Heirs of the estate
    The Bastard Hottentot Christiaan Bok son of the deceased being the only heir as far as information can be obtained

    This done and registered in the village ofon Saturday the 1st December 1827 in the presence of the clerks Christiaan Johannes Rabe and Walter Harding according to the statement of the field cornet Gerhardus Petrus Marais, who declares in his above statement of this estate to have acted honestly and truly, that nothing has been held back to the best of his knowledge and judgement and to be at all times ready (if called upon) to solemnize the same by oath, further promising and binding himself in the event of anything else belonging to this estate coming to his recollection and knowledge to amplify this inventory with the same

    For the statement: G:P: Marais, Veld Cornet

    As witnesses: C:J: Rabe, W: Harding

    W:W: Harding

    MOOC8/42.38¶

    {18270521} 21 May 1827 Magdalena Beukman

    J:G: Brink

    Inventory of the goods and effects belonging to the estate of the late Magdalena Beukman wid: Giliaume Wolfaard who departed on the 28th April 1827 at the place

    Done bij Christoffel Johannes Wolfaard at the requisition of the Board of Orphan Masters in their capacity as guardians of the minor children and grand children of said wid: Wolfaard

    Christoffel Johannes Wolfaard
    Gidion Jacobus
    Philippus Ernst
    Regina Barbera Wolfaard married with Gidion van Zijl
    Elisabeth Hendrica Wolfaard married with Matthijs Human
    Maria Wolfaard born in the year 1803
    the children of the late Johannes Cornelis Wolfaard named Giliaume Jacobus born in the year 1818
    Johannes Cornelis born in the year 1820
    Gabriel Jacobus born in the year 1822
    Jacobus Albartus in the year 1823
    Goods and effects belonging to the estate
    1 old waggon
    1 bedstead
    2 iron pots
    1 small cask
    1 mortar
    1 tea pot
    1 candle stick
    1 table
    1 earthen pot
    1 coffee mill
    5 chairs
    1 scrow
    1 bed
    3 oxen
    To Christoffel Johannes Wolfaard thirty rixdollars

    On this daij the 21 of May 1827.

    Appeared before me Johannes Petrus Muller acting for the Agent of the Orphan Chamber here, Christoffel Johannes Wolfaart who declare that he with regard to this statement has acted faithfully and uprightly and not to have witheld or concealed what he know to be the property of the said estate, promissing however that if any further property should be found, belonging to the estate that in such case to amply this inventory with the same being finally ready to make oath to the truth of this his statement

    C:J: Wolfaart

    Witness: Thomas Clarke

    MOOC8/42.39¶

    {18270511} 11 Mey 1827 Helena Johanna Laubscher

    Exhib: 20 Feb:y 1828

    No: 26

    Deputy Land:t Office27 Dec:r 1827

    Sir,

    In compliance with your request of the 19th instant I have the honor to enclose a return of the heirs of the late Helena Joh:a Laubscher

    I have the honor to be sir

    Your obed:t serv:t

    N: v: Ryneveld, Dep:y Land:t

    J:J:L: Smuts Esq:r, Sec:y Orphan Chamber

    Return of heirs of the late Helena Joh:a Laubscher and surviving husband Johannes Mosterd E: son

    1) Margaretha Joha:a Wiese, gehuwd met Joh:s Steenkamp Lucas son
    2) Sophia Helena Wiese, gehuwd met Gid:n van Zyl Adr:n son
    3) Isabella Christina Adriana Wiese, gehuwd met Joh:s Mosterd Joh:s son (not a son of the deceased)
    4) Joh:s Jac:s Wiese, gehuwd met Joh:a Marg:a Dreyer
    5) the children of the late Petrus Nicolaas Wiese, namely 1) Joh:s Aug:s about 7 years old
    2) Petrus Nic:s about 5 years old and
    3) Daniel about 3 years old
    6) Martha Eliz:th Wiese, gehuuwd met Joh:s Pet:s Botma
    and
    7) Geertr:a Wilhelm:a Wiese, married to Joh:s Hem:s Karsten Louis son

    NB: Deceased’s first husband was Johannes Jac:s Wiese

    MOOC8/42.40¶

    {18251216} 16 December 1825 Johan Ekkard Schnitler , Maria Hermina Stijl

    Inventaris van alle zodanige goederen behorende tot den gemeenschappelijke boedel en nalatenschap van wijlen Johannis Ekkard Snidler en nagelatene weduwe Maria Hermiena Stijl

    Zynde dese inventaris geformeerd en door ons ondergeteekendens in geschrifte gebragt in gevolge op ende aangave van gem: weduwe Snitler ten behoeve harer minderjarige kinderen, in name

    Barbara Magdalena Snidler [1808] 17 jaaren oud
    Johannis Ekkard Snidler [1813] 12 jaaren oud
    Elisabet Lodewika Snidler [1815] 10 jaaren oud
    Koenradiena Jacoba Snidler [1817] 8 jaaren oud
    Douw Lodewijk Snidler [1819] 6 jaaren oud
    Doratie Kirstiena Snidler [1823] 2 jaaren oud
    Bestaande de goederen als volgt
    een tavel
    vier stoelen
    een kist
    drie vaten in soort
    vier emmers
    twee katels
    twee beddens
    een kopere keetel
    een trekpotje
    twee boterpotjes
    een koopere koffykan
    twee dosyn borde in soort
    vier schotels in soort
    agtien tinne lepels
    twaalf vorken
    twaalf messe
    vier aarde potten
    vier bottels in soort
    twee klijne kanne
    drie kandelaars in soort
    een kastrol
    een kannetje half met groene verf
    twee eyzere potten
    een eyzere lepel
    een geweer
    een loop van een geweer met de slot
    een zaag
    vier boren in soort
    twee oude kisten
    een hantbijl
    twee graven
    een smits winkel
    zes hondert lb eijster
    een party oud eyster
    een neuwe wagen de houtwerk
    een half slete osse wagen
    trekgoed voor twaalf ossen
    elf ossen
    een merrij paard met een vul
    schuld 143 rijksd:

    Aldus gedaan en geinventariseert ter plaatsein het distriktop den 16 Dec: 1825 op het op en aangeven van den in den hoofde deses gem: Maria Hermiena Steyl, dewelke aan ons verklaard heef zig hier in ter goeder trouw te hebben gedragen en hare wetens niets agter gehouden te hebben, dat tot haren boedel zouden behoren, bereijd zijnde om zo wanneer het een of ander mog worden gevonden als dan dese inventaris daar mede te zullen vergroten

    den 16 Dec: 1825

    Als getuijgen: P:J: du Preez, D:W: Steyn, Veldc:

    2 emmers

    2 schaaf blokke
    2 oude schaaren
    2 oude kandelaars
    1 boor, 1 vyl, 1 bytel
    2 scheermesse en een scheerdoos

    1 rol stok
    2 oude kaatel
    2 ploeg wielen
    1 ploeg schaar
    1 oude rak
    1 sambok
    1 waater vaatje
    Aan den boedel debet
    Jacob van Eeden de waagen na de Kaap gehaad met zijn toebehooren, en eenmaal de wagen na de Kaap gehaad met zijn toebehooren na de
    Jan Human J:zoon drie mud kooren debet voor huis dekke
    de Hottentot July, woonagtig by Dirk Uijs nog debet voor voering velle rd:s3
    De boedel schuldig
    paid aan Daniel Steyn, debet rd:s300 van den 9:en Maart 1814
    paid aan Frederik Jacobus van Zijl debet rd:s50
      in de moeders porsie die den 13 September 1820 beweese is ter Weeskaamer aan Kaap de Goede Hoop aan de vyf minderjaarigen kinderen behoorende aan de gemelde Steyn
    paid 25 rd:s voor 1 dot kes aan F:k J:s Raabe

    Aldus gedaan en geinvantariseerd ten huise van den gem: Steijn staande op de plaats van den Jacobus Frederik Steijn gen:d deen zulks op aangeving van zyn zoon van de gem:d Steyn, dewelke na zijn best weeten heeft opgeven

    Aldus gedaan op den 1 April 1825 op de plaats

    H: Steijn Velt C:t

    Als getuige: Andries Heijns, Barend B: Cosijn

    Thus done and inventoried atin the district ofon this the 13th September 1827 according to the statement made by Aletta Maria de Lange who declared to have acted in the case with integrity and not to her knowledge to have kept back anything appertaining to the estate, promising that if anything should hereafter be found belonging to this estate that it shall be then added to this inventory.

    Thus done and signed in the presence of James OReilly and George Aldrich who act as witnesses.

    J: O’Reilly, G: Aldrich

    Aletta Maria de Lange

    MOOC8/42.44¶

    {18280619} 19 June 1828 Hendrik Emanuel Blanckenberg

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Hendrik Emanuel Blanckenberg on the 13th day of the month of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight for the benefit of his children procreated in lawful marriage with his predeceased wife Elizabeth Rossouw, namely

    1) Maria Elizabeth Blanckenberg
    2) Johanna Catharina married to William Stringer
    3) Elizabeth Wilhelmina
    4) Johannes Gysbertus
    4) Hendrik Emanuel
    6) Jacobus Gabriel born on the [ ..... ]
    7) Aletta Hendrina born on the [ ..... ]
    8) Carel Gerhardus born on the [ ..... ]
    9) Daniel Rossouw Blanckenberg born on the [ ..... ]

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of his aforesaid heirs and been inventoried by the undersigned special Commissioners of the Board aforesaid, was found to consist in the following viz:

    In a house belonging to Mr Jacobus Petrus de Wet

    a sofa
    a table
    1 liquor case
    1 water juge
    1 set of fire irons
    nine shells
    a silver soup ladle
    six silver tea spoons
    five plated tea spoons
    nine plated table spoons
    a tea set
    a confit pot
    two plated snuffers and stand
    two toast racks
    a plated mustard pot
    two plated salt cellers
    four bottle stand
    a snuffer and stand
    a small waiter
    a large waiter
    a tea set defect
    three earthen pots
    four decanters
    thirteen tumblers
    eighteen wineglasses
    a butter pot
    two glass dishes
    three salt cellars
    twenty six dish mats
    a small butter tub
    a case with linseed oil
    two tables
    two dum waiters
    a bedstead
    In the pantry
    a copper tea urn
    a copper tea kettle and chaven dish
    a coffy pot, tea pot, sugar pot, milk kettle
    a small waiter
    six candle sticks
    a silver sugar pot
    a crued stand
    a coffy urn
    five tin cannisters
    a salt cannister
    a tea tray
    twenty five forks
    twenty two knives
    a spout
    an earthen pot
    two brooms
    two demignons
    a tea set and some earthen ware
    two decanters
    a butter pot
    two salt cellars and salt spoon
    one table
    a p: of shoe buckles
    a blue table servies, defective
    two jug's
    two coffy pots
    a pueter [pots]
    a funnel
    three jelly forms
    a lanthorn
    a tart pan
    a liquor case
    twelve chairs
    two tables
    a chest of drawers
    two dom waiters
    a green table cloth /the property of Mrs Strenger/
    In the bed room
    a sofa
    a carpet
    seven beds complete 2 for the children, 1 belonging to Mrs Strenger
    three bed steads
    one stretcher
    one snuf box and two tobacco boxes
    In the kitchen
    eight iron pots
    two tart pans
    two ham kettles
    a water [kettles]
    a frying pan, a grid iron, two ladles, three forks, a chopping block, two water half aums
    a table
    an hatched
    a frying pan
    a ladder
    two tubs and two buckets
    Upstairs
    one halfaum with vinegar
    a can with paint
    two cannisters
    1 case with candles
    five [case] with remnant
    five empty flasks and bottles
    a glass desert centre piece
    a small table
    Slaves of the estate
    a slave boy n:d Daantje of the Cape 44 y:s of age, cook
    a slave boy n:d Fraai of the Cape 44 y:s of age, coachman
    a slave boy n:d Gidion of the Cape 40 y:s, taylor
    a slave boy n:d Maart of the Cape 22 y:s of age
    a slave boy n:d Kameis of the Cape 20 y:s of age
    a slave boy n:d Joumat of the Cape 19 y:s of age
    a slave boy n:d Romalang of the Cape 16 y:s of age
    a female slave Flora of the Cape 28 y:s of age, sempstress, with her child named Sarima born 8 March 1828
    a female slave Sima of the Cape 28 y:s of age, sempstress, with her children nd: Samuel born 4 August 1817
    Abdol born 24 Sept:r 1823
    Agerodien born 4 Novemb: 1826
    a female slave n:d Sara of the Cape 42 y:s of age, housemaid, with her children n:d Siedie born 10 Novemb: 1818
    Cassier born 3 Juny 1823
    Rea born 15 March 1827
    Japie 14 Ap: 21 - dood
    Claims in favour of the estate
      Rd:s
    from Mr G:A: Watermeyer for the purchase of canteen 100
    from Mr G:A: Watermeyer for a legacy received by him out of the estate of the late Ronnenkamp 50
    Dubious
      Rd:s
    from the late Jas: Alex:r Fehrsen on a note of hand dated 14 April 1818 420
    from J:G: Tredouw on a note of hand dated 6 April 1802 400
    from J:H: Fischer on a note of hand dated 15 Decemb: 1797 300
    from J:H: Fischer on a note of hand dated 1 Octob: 1798 500
    from Hendrik Mellet on a note of hand dated 20 May 1825 80
    from Hendrik Theubes on two notes of hand for which he has been summoned by the advocate Jan Hoffmeyer - the notes alluded to amounts of rd:s3140 dated 12 August 1822 and the other rd:s2500 dated 15 Sep: 1825 according to Mr the adv: Hen: H:meyer's statement, S: 6000

    It is hereby notified that the claims against the estate can not be correctly enumerated.

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope on the 19 June 1828 according to a statement by Hendrik Emanuel Blanckenberg, who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate and the said appearer further declared that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered, shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearer and me the Secretary have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioners: J: Brand, C: Blanckenberg

    H:E: Blanckenberg

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/42.45¶

    {18270724} 24 July 1827 Baart Steenhuys

    Inventory of all such property as have been sent to this Office as the effects relinquished by the death ab intestato of Baart Steenhuys on the eighth day of the month of July in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven for the benefit of his unknown foreign heirs.

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of the aforesaid unknown foreign heirs and been inventoried by the undersigned, was found to consist in the following viz:t

    a trunk
    a mattress
    two pillows
    a blanket
    two shirts
    seven p:rs trowsers
    one waistcoat
    two jackets
    a p:r boots
    a p:r braces
    four false collars
    seven p:r stockings
    three caps
    a handkerchief
    a brush
    a razer
    a shaving box
    a piece soap
    a small box
    a box with some thread
    a tin cannister
    seven books
    a pocket pistol
    a looking glass
    a looking glass, defective
    a bason
    a small stone bottle
    a small glass bottle
    two spoons
    a fork
    a wine glass
    a comb
    Cash found
    a silver Dutch shilling piece
    two silver Dutch stivers

    It is hereby further noticed that Mr P: Woutersen as Agent of the Dutch shiphas stated that the funeral expences and other charges of the Somerset Hospital to the amount of rd:s[ ..... ] has been paid by him for account of the ship, and that no money has been left in his hands for wages due to the deceased.

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope on the twenty fourth day of the month of July in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven.

    As Commissioners: G:E:s Overbeek

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/42.46¶

    {18200218} 18 February 1820 Aletta Booyzen

    H: Ellis

    Inventaris van alle zodanige goederen en effecten als er door wylen Aletta Booyzen laast weduwe wylen Johannes Klaassen zyn bezeeten en ab intestao met er dood ontruimd en nagelaaten, mitsgad:s heeden opgenoomen en in waaren weezen zyn bevonden geworden, te weeten

    een buldzak
    drie kussens
    een combaars
    een koeygoed zak
    een stoof
    een aarde water pot
    een klyne koopere keetel
    een tinne bord
    een tinne leepel
    een vork
    drie leedige bottels
    een kist met hang slot waar in
    vier boeken in zoort
    vier vrouwen zakken
    een blikke bus
    twee snuyfdoosen
    een bril
    vier paar koussen
    een beugel tasch, kooper
    een schaar
    een waayer
    twee kammen
    drie voerchitze tjaals in zoort
    een lanset
    twee aarde potjes
    een voorschoot
    vier doeken
    twee kooy laakens
    vier servetten
    elf vrouwen mutzen
    drie hemden
    een voerchitze tabbert
    seven jakjes in zoort
    seven rokken
    een borst rok
    een voorschoot
    een papiere doosje met wat rommelary
    seeven en een half elle wit linnen
    drie kopjes
    wat tabak
    een snuyf zift
    Schulden des boedels
      Rd:s
    aan de weduwe Dirk Booyzen over begraffenis onkosten 56:6
    Erfgenaamen
    1) Joh:s Booyzen broeder van de overleedene
    2) de kinderen van wylen Dirk Booyzen a) Barend
    b) Aletta
    c) Johanna Sophia
    d) Hermina
    e) Maria Jacoba Magdalena
    f) Anna Fran:a Chath:a Adriana
    g) Aletta Elis: Christ:a
    h) Dirkje Johanna Willemina
    3) de kinderen van Hermina Booyzen gehuwd geweest met Joh:s Tobias Benadie zyn a) Johannes Tobias
    b) Jurgen
    c) wylen Dirk Christ:l de kinderen de opgeefster onbekend
    d) Anna Francina
    e) Elisabeth gehuwt geweest met Jacob Salomon Reeder
    f) Hermina gehuwd geweest met Jan Neft
    4) de kinderen van wylen Maria Booyzen gehuwd geweest met wylen Jan van Eeden zyn a) Aletta
    5) de kinderen van wylen Anna Francina Booyzen gehuwd geweest met Fredrik van Eeden zyn drie ten getalle egter de opgeefster onbekend

    Aldus gedaan en geinventariseerd ten dorpeop den 18:de February 1820 volgens op en aangeeven van de burgeres Aletta van den Berg weduwe wylen Dirk Booyzen dewelke verklaarde haar in het op en aangeeven des boedels ter goeder trouwe te hebben gedraagen en niets met weeten versweegen of agter gehouden, verklaarende haar dus bereid deeze haare opgaave ten alle tyde des gevordert werdende met solemneele eede te zullen staven met verdere belofte zo iets nader tot den boedel behoorende mogte ontdekken deezen inventaris daarmeede te zullen amplieeren, en is zulks geschiet in het by weezen van de edele Jan Barend van Blerk en den clercq Jerem:s Auret als getuigen

    Als getuigen: J:B: van Blerk, J: Auret

    Aletta van den Bergh weduwe Dirk Booijsen

    In kennisse van my: I:W: Muller

    No: 8

    Copy

    James’s Party 6 Feb:y 1828

    Inventory of property of the late Isaac Own James, alias John James, who died on the 16 January last [the original statement of the Agent]

    19 cows
    7 calves
    2 heifers
    1 steer
    12 oxen
    1 bull
    2 mares
    1 foal
    1 bridle and saddle
    1 gun
    1 silver cased watch
    1 great coat
    1 black coat
    2 jackets
    2 waistcoats
    1 shirt
    2 p: of trousers
    1 Bible
    1 box
    1 mattras
    1 felt combers
    2 blankets
    cash 90 doll:s to be accounted for by Mr James
    1 pocket book containing sundry accounts, notes of hand and letters
    half a share in some wheat and Indien corn

    The said Isaac Owen James alias John James, was about 32 years of age, and his parents Abraham and Martha James were living atinin June 1822 and letter in deceaseds pocket book

    Deceased came out as a settler in Mr Phillip’s party in 1820

    Signed: W: Currie, Sam:l James

    Mr de Villiers

    The above property has been left in charge of Mr James, previous to my going there the cash had been used by Mr James for funeral expences and an account of which, with some other accounts he tendered to me, but declined receiving them, referring him to you

    Sig:d: W: Currie

    {18280214} 14 February 1828 Sanna van de Kaap

    Inventory of all such property as have been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Sanna of the Cape deceased slave of Johan Fredrik Gilowy on the sixth day of the month of February in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight for the benefit of her two children, named

    Claartje born 6 January 1817
    Amilie born 26 Nov:r 1818

    the aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters at the Cape of Good Hope in behalf of her aforesaid two children and been inventoried by the undersigned Commissioners, was found to consist in the following viz:

    At the house of Johan Fredrik Gilowy

    a ward robe containing
    twenty three petty coats
    fourteen spencers and 4 silk spencers
    five p: of stays
    six towels
    ten pieces of remnants
    one piece of cotton print
    two [piece] of linnen
    a remnant of ticking
    eight bed sheets
    twelve pillow cases
    two shifts
    twenty pieces of remnant of chints etc:a
    three p:r of stockens
    one lace hand kerchief
    one shawl
    four [shawl]
    a p: of shoes
    forty one silk and other hand kerchiefs
    four pieces of linnen /remnants/
    a neck lace
    four combs
    a small box with thread
    twelve gold buttons
    seventeen silver buttons
    four sets of beades
    a gold watch
    four finger rings
    two p:r of ear rings
    a gold breast pin
    eleven pearl buttons
    three small boxes
    a diamond for a breast pin
    two boxes, one containing a remnand of tea
    three tin cannisters
    one lanthorn
    two jars
    a large cannister
    a looking glass
    six iron spoons
    a tea kettle
    two stone jars
    one chest with bottels and cans
    a tin tea kettle
    two jalousie mats
    a table
    three plates
    a mattras, 6 pillows, a blanket
    eight chairs
    a trunk
    a puter tea pot
    a smoothing iron
    Cash
      Rd:s
    one pence half penny 0:4
    Debts of the estate
      Rd:s
    to her mother Clara for money's lent to her 5
    Credits of the estate
      Rd:s
    from Philida 10

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope on the 14 February 1828 according to a statement made by Mrs Gilowy and her mother Clara, who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowledge they have not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and the said appearers further declared that they are and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm their statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall and will faithfully communicate it to the Orph: Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearers and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commissioners: J:s Brand, R: Blanckenberg

    J:J: Gilowij, mark + of Clara

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    1 coffee mill
    1 tea pot
    1 candle stick
    11 spoons and six forks
    3 canisters
    1 saddle and bridle
    1 grinding stone
    1 bedstead
    1 vice
    6 horses harness
    2 mill stones
    1 plough
    1 bullock waggon
    1 horse waggon
    3 bottles, two with oil
    2 cups, one saucer
    4 plates
    1 basket
    1 stove and tub

    7 sacks

    1 pan

    none

    7 horses
    1 horse, sold, absent
    23 oxen
    35 head breeding cattle
    860 sheep
    57 goats
    Cash

    to Adam Gilfillan six rix dollars
    to Hermanus Steyn six rix dollars

    a note of hand of Rolof Nicolaas van den Berg for the sum of rix dollars three hundred and forty payable on the 23:d September 1827

    Magrieta Johanna Pretorious by the present wife born on the 22 April 1823

    Thus done and inventoried atin the district ofon this the 6th July 1827 according to the statement made by Christina Petronella de Wennaar who declared to have acted in the case with integrity and not to her knowledge to have kept back any thing appertaining to the estate, promising that if anything should hereafter be found belonging to this estate and which may have been omitted that it should be then added to this inventory. This done and signed in the presence of James OReilly and George Aldrich as witnesses.

    As witnesses: J: O’Reilly, G: Aldrich

    C:J: de Wennaar wedewe J:L: Pretoreus

    MOOC8/43.1¶

    F.G. Kotzee {18271018} 18 October 1827

    Exh: 27 Feb:y 1828 N: 6

    den 18 October .... ]

    Weledele Heer

    Hier ingesloten bekomd vermelden den invontaris van den boedel van wylen den weduwe F:G: Kotzee het welk ik heb gemaakt in bywezen van A:H:P: Louw, Megiel G: Visser als getuygen, W: Louw, J:G: Kotzee als erfgenaamen teffens bekomd uweledele den registrasies van den

    slaaven behooren aan gem: boedel

    Ik heb de eer te zyn Weledele Heer uw ed: dienaar

    G:W:J: van Zyl, Veldc:

    Den weledele heer J: van Ryneveld, Adj: Landdros,

    den 18 October 1827

    Weledele Heer

    Een andwoord op Uweledele van den 9 dezer dat den perzoon van Matys Greef myn heeft verzogt Uweledele te melden dat hy na den werk zal zien en ook zal doen zo als tevoren maar dat hy niet schryve kan om een aantekening te houden en dat hy hem onbekwaam bevind om met vee om te gaan; op dien aard heb ik aan W: Louw verzogd om een aantekening te houden van het geen dat by komt en afgaad

    Ik heb de eer te zyn weledele heer U weled: dienaar

    Den weledele heer J: van Ryneveld, Adj: Landdros,

    G:W:J: van Zyl, Veldc:

    Staat en invontaris van zodanig goederen en effecten als door Sophia Johanna Smit weduwe wylen Frederik Gidion Kotzee Dirkz:n ten plaatsemet den dood op den 28 July 1827 namiddag om 4 uuren in den ouderdom van 53 jaren 11 maanden en 17 dagen zyn nagelaten geworden en de zulks ten voordelen van den volgende erfgenamen

    1) J:M:S: Kotzee gehuuwd met Willim Louw H:z
    2) J:F:G: Kotzee oud 27 jaaren
    3) Sophia J:C: Kotzee oud 19 jare

    Woonhuys

    In het voorhuys
    5 stoelen
    3 tafels
    2 banke
    1 ly
    In de kamer op de regterhand
    1 katel
    3 kiste
    1 geweer
    1 boeke rak

    4 kuype

    In de winkel

    1 trekzaag

    In de wagenhuys

    Uytstaande penningen
     
    een schuldbewys ten lasten van J:L: Kotzee J:z 2 osse debit
    1 schuldbewys ten laste van de weduwe J: Kotzee groot rd:s35
    door D: E: Grimbeek gezedeerd op de weduwe J:G: Kotzee
    een schuldbewys van J: Basson groot rd:s15 - paid
    Schulden ten lasten des boedels
        Rd:s
    paid aan J:A: Louw J:z groot 260
    paid volgens opgaf van den erfgenamen is Matys Greef gehuurd den 29 Desimber 1819 voor de zomma van ryksd: 120 per jaar hier op ontvange blykens rekeningen 191:3

    Aldus geinvontarriceerd ter plaatzegelegen in den Adj: Drosdyop den 17 October 1827

    Door myn: G:W:J: van Zyl, Veldc:

    en bywezen van 2 onpartydige getuygen: 1) A:H:P: Louw J:z, 2) A:J: Visser J:z

    Als ook die van de erfgenamen: W:m Louw H:z, J:F:G: Kotzee

    Heirs to the estate
    1) Joh:s Fred: Gidion Kotze mondig
    2) Johanna Maria Sophia Kotze get: met Willem Louw Herm:zn
    3) Sophia Johanna Catharina Kotze born 19 July 1808

    J:A: Brink

    Inventaris van alle zodanige goederen en effecten, als er door wylen Johannes Petrus Meintjes en nagelatene weduwe Elisabeth Margaretha Botha in gemeenschap zyn bezeten en door eerstgemelde ab intestato met er dood ontruimd op den 11 July 1827, mitsgaders op heeden opgenomen en bevonden te bestaan in

    Schulden des boedels
      Rd:s
    aan Daniel Johannes Hend:k Meintjes bl: bewys p:r rest 36:7:2
    aan Daniel Johannes Hend:k Meintjes bl: reekning 102:--:--
    aan Hend:k Lod: Momberg H:zn 20:--:--
    aan C:J: Henderson 13:--:--
    aan Paul Fauche bl: bewys 32:--:--
    aan P: Heugh C:zn bl: rekening 4:1:--
    Erfgenamen des boedels
    1) Jacoba Elisabeth Meintjes gehuwd geweest met Willem Gerhardus Engelbregt door den overledene in huwelyk verwekt met zyne eerste huisvrouw Magdalena Erasmus
    2) Daniel Johannes Hendrik Meintjes geb: den 21 August 1796 door den overledene in huwelyk verwekt met zyn tweede huisvrouw Hester Cecilia Olivier
    3) Johannes Petrus Meintjes geb: den 9 July 1809 door den overledene in huwelyk verwekt met de overgelatene weduwe
    4) Fredrik Johannes Meintjes geb: den 2 October 1810
    5) Maria Catharina Meintjes geb: den 15 Juny 1813
    6) Jacoba Albertus Meintjes geb: den 15 Sept: 1815
    7) Adriaan Albertus Meintjes den 2 Maart 1822
    8) Johannes Petrus Engelbregt geb: den [ ..... ] kinderen van de 1 erfgename
    9) Catharina Engelbregt geb: den [ ..... ]
    10) Magdalena Engelbregt geb: den [ ..... ]
    11) Willem Engelbregt geb: den [ ..... ]
    12) Jacoba Elizabeth Engelbregt geb: den [ ..... ]

    Aldus gedaan en geinventariseerd op den 8 September 1827 volgens op en aangave van Daniel Johannes Hendrik Meintjes, dewelke verklaarde zich in het op en aangeeven des voormelden boedels ter goeder trouwe te hebben te gedragen en niets met weten verswegen of agtergehouden te hebben, allesdoende onder aanbod van eede met verdere belofte zo zig iets nader tot den boedel behorende mogte komen te ontdekken, deezen inventaris daarmeede te zullen amplieeren.

    Ende is zulks geschied door my ondergetekende agent der Weeskamer ter presentie van Jacobus Johannes Meintjes Stephanuszoon en Gysbert Johannes Broekhuizen

    Voor de opgaave: Daniel Meyntjes

    Als getuigen: J:J: Meintjes, G:J: Broekhuizen

    J:A: Meintjes

    MOOC8/43.3¶

    {18271105} 5 November 1827 Margaretha Elisabeth Slabber

    Ex:hd 7 November 1827 N:o 28

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Margaretha Elisabeth Slabber on the 15th day of the month of October in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven, for the benefit of her surviving husband George Nelson Lond on the one, and her eight children begotten in wedlock with her said husband, named

    1) Hendrina Orgina Johanna Lond married to B: Wools on the other part
    2) Anna Elisabeth Lond born on the 12 February 1807
    3) Susanna Louisa Lond born on the 8th August 1808
    4) Dirk Nelson Lond born on the 14th March 1810
    5) Maria Berta Dolphina Lond born on the 5th November 1814
    6) Margaretha Elisabeth Jacoba Lond born on the 15th April 1814
    7) George Nelson Lond born on the 20th November 1817
    8) Johanna Jacoba Lond born on the 15th September 1827

    The aforesaid property having been inventoried by the undersigned Commissioners of the Board of Orphan Masters, according to a statement made by the aforesaid husband and was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    A place calledsituated in the Cape District at thetogether with two pieces of freehold and four pieces of perpetual quitrent land annex thereto
    a piece of perpetual quitrent land adjacent thereto according to the title deed dated 23 May 1823 called
    two pieces of freehold land situated in the Cape district oposit the first mentioned place, according to the title deed dated 28 September 1821

    In the house on the first mentioned place

    In the hall
    ten chairs
    three tables
    two green table cloths
    a spy glass
    In a room n:o 1
    a table
    a sofa
    a bureau
    a stretcher

    a male slave named Jonas of this Colony 14 years of age
    a female slave named Julinda of this Colony 25 years of age, with her four children named Loressa born on the 4th June 1821 Aron born on the 25 August 1821 Nisa born on the 6 July 1825 2 Nisa born on the [ ..... ] July 1827
    a female slave named Aaltje of this Colony 31 years of age with five children, named Carolina born on the 16 January 1817 Amilie born on the 12 January 1819 Agida born on the 25 December 1821 Moestaphas born on the 24 July 1823 Alida born on the [ ..... ]
    also a male slave named Adonis condemned tofor life
    twenty thousand pounds of hay

      interest since 1 Jan:ry 1826

      to Jacobus Blankenberg per balance of a sputence

      interest since May 1826
    paid rd:s90 to T: Deichman for a coffin   100
      to Johnson for hire of a boy   50
    rd:s733:16 to Michau Teubes about   300
    only rd:s90 to Menter for a saddle   95
      to Dreyer for smithswork   20

    To this estate also belongs two pieces of land, situated at the, called the, which he purchased from Albert Louw, who is transported to, and paid for rd:s1100, without he has been abled as yet to obtain transfer of the same

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope at the place aforesaid on the 5th day of the month of November in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven, according to a statement made by the survivor who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted anything that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and the said appearer further declared that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement by solemn oath if required promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall and will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof I the Commissioner together with the appearer and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioner: J: Horne

    G:N: Lond

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/43.4a¶

    {18280215} 15 February 1828 Petrus Diemel

    Staat en inventaris van alle zoodanige goederen en effecten, als op den 12:e December 1827 ab intestato met er dood ontruimd en nagelaten zyn, door den weledele achtbare heer Petrus Diemel, in deszelfs leeven lid van den Hoog Edele Achtbare Raade van Justitie deezer volkplanting en zulks ten behoeve van de zoodanige dewelke het zoude moogen aangaan, ter requisitie van den weledele heer Johannes Joachim Lodewyk Smuts, in deszelfs betrekking als Secretaris van het eerwaard Collegie van heeren Weesmeesteren, na luide van deszelfs missive van den 8:e February j:l: geformeerd, en door my Petrus Canzius van Blommestein, Notaris Publiek in het district vanresteerende, ter presentie der hiernatenoemene getuigen in geschrift gebracht, bestaande alle die goederen en effecten in als volgt

    Ter plaatsegelegen aan de, in dit district het eigendom van de heer Philip van der Byl, al waar de overledene tot zyn dood heeft gewoond

    vier koffers in soorten
    vyf trommels in soorten
    een hoede doos
    drie hoeden in soorten
    vier paar schoenen
    een paar muilen
    een Schotsche mantel
    een zwarte lakensche rok
    twee blauwe lakensche gekleede jassen
    een blaauw lakensche broek
    een zwarte lakensche broek
    een zwarte lakensche broek
    een zwarte zyde onder vesje
    een nieuw blaauw gryne baadje
    een jacht jekkert
    acht witte broeken
    elf ander vesjes van diverse couleuren
    twee witte bove baadjes
    een zwart fluweel calotje
    tien zak doeken
    twintig paar sokken
    twee nacht cabaayen
    acht onderbroeken
    twee flenelsche onderbaatjes
    vier witte gebreide slaapmutsen
    drie paar handschoenen
    een paar zwarte zyde koussen
    zeventien hembden
    vier witte halsdoeken
    een zwarte zyde [halsdoeken]
    sestien handoeken in soorten
    drie Keulsche kannetjes waarin een
    weinig drank
    een ledige mand
    twee chambreelen
    een wandelstok (bamboes)
    een breukband
    een juk koker met twee glase flesjes
    een kleine scheer spiegel
    twee verlakte schenkblaadjes
    twee verlakte water bekers
    een verlakte blaker, snuiter en domper
    een pletty kandelaar
    een kopere tafelschel
    een kleine dieve lantaarn
    twee scheer kokers met vier scheermessen
    een strykriem en scheerdoek
    twee kleine doosjes met wat soda poeders
    een kleine tinne tregter
    een ouwel cachet
    een verre kyker
    vyf en tachtig boeken in soorten
    een tinne inktkoker
    twee blikke ouwel doosjes
    een scheer kwasje met een tin bakje
    twee wyn kelken
    twee bier glasen
    drie ledige oude Colongne flesjes
    twee bottels limoenstroop
    een [bottels] zuure limoen sop
    een [bottels] suiker bosjes siroop
    vier ledige flesjes
    een schoteltje
    een hair borstel
    twee scharen
    een boubeen
    twee potlooten
    twee knip messen
    een kurke trekker
    een klein rood zak boekje
    een groen beursje
    een jacht fles
    twee kannetjes met schoene smeer
    een koker waarin een lepel, etc:a
    goud, zilver, juweel en compositiewerk
    een juweele borstspeld in een blaauwe steen gemonteerd met deszelfs rood Marokyne ledere kokertje
    een zilver zak horologie
    een spinsbek zak horologie
    een zilvere vergulde snuifdoos
    een bril in het zilver gemonteerd
    een oogglaasje mede in het zilver gemonteerd
    een oogglaasje in hoorn gemonteerd
    een zilver thee lepeltje
    twee brillen niet te weeten waarin gemonteerd
    Contanten des boedels
        Rd:s
    kept by Mr Van der Byl aan Engelsche zilver geld 144:2:4
    kept by Mr Van der Byl 25 Hollandsche dubbeltjes 1:0:2
      vier Hollandsche stuivers 0:0:4
      aan Engelsche koper geld 6:4:4
    Lasten des boedels
        Rd:s
    paid aan P:C: van Blommestein de volgende betaalde dood en begraffeniskosten [ ..... ]
    aan vier slippe draagers 96:--
    aan twaalf dragers 144:--
    aan twee kosters 48:--
    aan twee trapsluiters 6:--
    voor de doodkist 104:--
    aan kerke geregtigheeden 15:4:--

    Aldus gedaan en geinventariseerd op de hofsteede, gelegen in dit district aan deden 15 February 1828, ende zulks op het op en aangeeven van de heeren Philip van der Byl, dewelke verklaarde hem daaromtrent ter goeder trouwe te hebben gevragen en niets met opzet verzweegen en agter gehouden te hebben, het geen tot de gemelde nalatenschap is behoorende, bereid zynde zulks met solemneele eede (des gerequireerd) te bevestigen, belovende ingevalle hierna eenige goederen of effecten tot den boedel specteerende mochte koomen te ontdekken, als dan deeze inventaris daarmede te zullen amplieeren en zulks ten byweezen van den weledele heer Daniel Johannes van Ryneveld en de heer Philip Wouter de Vos Hendrikzoon als getuigen hiertoe verzocht, die de minute deezes benevens gemelde heer Van der Byl en mij notaris mede behoorlyk op zegul van tien schellingen hebben gesubscribeerd

    Quod attestor: P:C: v: Blommestein, Not:s

    MOOC8/43.4b¶

    {18280205} 5 February 1828 Pieter Diemel

    Exhib: 20 Feb:y 1828 n:o 46

    Inventory of all such property as have been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Pieter Diemel on the 12 December in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven for the benefit of his unknown foreign heirs

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters at the Cape of Good Hope in behalf of his unknown foreign heirs and been inventoried by the undersigned Commissioner, was found to consist in the following

    At the house of M:r Josh Alb:s van Breda

    A wood ruler containing
    a lantharn
    a bazon
    two candle sticks
    a p:r of snuffers, one stand
    five tin cannisters
    a trissing box
    a small trunk
    a p:r shoe buckles
    a p:r knee buckles
    a neck [buckles]
    a [ ..... ] for a p:r of breeches
    two laurignettes
    six watch glasses
    two small glister pipes
    a p:r of spectacles
    an opera glass
    an opera glass defective
    a few glasses for opera
    a spy glass defective
    two wine glasses
    two umbrellas
    a truss /bruekband/
    eight pot glasses
    three p:r of shoes
    six pictures
    a large trunk
    a hat and a cap
    four waistcoats
    a p:r of trowsers
    a p:r of breeches
    a jacket
    a shirts
    a night goun
    two towels
    a quantity of small bottles
    one hundred and forty six books
    a few book containing journals
    a few bundles of Cape Gazets

    Thus inventorised at the Cape of Good Hope in the house aforesaid on the 5th day of the month of February 1828 according to a statement made by M:r Breda who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted anything that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and the said appearer further declared that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement by solemn oath if required, promising at this auction that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered, shall and will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with this property so discovered

    In witness whereof I the Commissioner together with the appearer and the Secretary subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioner: F: Brand

    A: v: Breda

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/43.5¶

    {18250614} 14 June 1825 Andries Johannes Kunz , Anna Elisabeth Kok

    J:G: Brink

    Inventory of the goods and effects belonging to the estate of the late Andries Johannes Kunz and his surviving widow Anna Elisabeth Kok, departed on the 4th instant in the field of the place of Adriaan Crous

    Done by the widow of said deceased Kunz at the requisition of the Board of Orphan Masters at the Cape of Good Hope in their capacity as guardians of the minor children of the said Kunz, named

    Christiaan Fredrik born the 8th February 1816
    Johannes Jacobus born 26th January 1818
    Elisabeth Willemina Bergh born the 17th January 1821
    Barbera Magdalena born the 27 March 1823

    consisting of the goods and effects as following viz:

    8 tables
    14 chairs
    2 bedsteads
    11 painting pictures
    2 looking glasses
    1 closet
    1 writing desk
    2 beds
    2 chests
    1 small [chests] with lumbers

    1 gridiron

    3 hatchets

    3 pigs
    1 hous and erf situated in the town of
    1 male slave named Anthony from Mosambique

    1 male slave named January from this Colony
    1 male slave named Titus from this Colony
    1 female slave named Amelie from Mosambique
    1 female slave named Philida from Mosambique
    1 female slave named Spaas from this Colony

    and other effects belonging to this estate

    On this day the 14th June 1825

    Appeared before me Johannes Petrus Muller duly authorised by m:r J:J: Bam in his capacity of agent of Orphan Masters above mentioned

    Mrs Anna Elisabeth Kok widow of the late A:J: Kunz

    Who declareth that she with regard to this her statement had acted faithfully and upreihtly and not to have withheld or concealed what she know to be the property of said estate promessing however that if any further property should be found belonging to the estate, in such a case to amplify this inventory with the same, being finally ready to make oath for the truth of this her statement

    This done and executed at the place of Jan Adam Kunz situated in the district of, die et anno ut supra

    As witnesses: P:C: Odendal, H:J:Crous

    A:E: Kok, widow A:J: Kunz

    J:P: Muller

    MOOC8/43.6¶

    {18280610} 10 June 1828 Jacobus Alexander Fhersen

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Jacobus Alexander Fehrsen on the fifth day of the month of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight, for the benefit of his three children begotten in wedlock by his late wife

    1) Maria Margaretha born on the [ ....]
    2) Oloff Jacobus
    3) Jan Andries Fhersen

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of his said children and been inventoried by the undersigned special Commissioner of the Board aforesaid, was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    a large trunk, which contained
    a silver coffy pot
    two silver forks
    two boxes, silver mounted, for knifes and forks
    a toilet glass
    a gold watch
    two decanters
    seven plates
    a silver sweetmeatfork
    one silver teaspoon
    two small spoons (tin)
    a small box with papers
    a handbason and juck
    five plates
    four candle sticks
    five wine glasses
    two tumblers
    one earthen juck
    one coverdish
    two sugarpots
    a night candlesticks
    a lantern
    a tin cannister
    three spoons
    three knives
    one fork
    a bedstead
    a fetherbed
    four pillows
    one bolster
    one blancket
    eight chairs
    two tables, belonging to Mr Jacobus van Oudtshoorn
    two tables
    an old curtain
    a cubbort (defect)
    a small kettel
    a frying pan
    a grid iron
    an iron pot, belonging to Jack
    a leddle
    one trunk, containing the clothes of the deceased, namely
    five pairs of trousers
    three waistcoats
    two coats
    three jackets
    three shirts
    two blanckets
    eight handkerchiefs
    eleven pairs of stockings
    one rasor
    one spir
    one teaspoon
    one nightcap
    four books
    one chamberpot
    one greatcoat
    a knightgown
    three pairs of shoes
    one hat
    one horse
    one saddle and bridle
    one bedstead at the Wineberg despensary at Dr Girt
    one sofa
    one winecase
    two tables with slaight
    one looking glass
    twelve chairs at Jacobus van Oudtshoorn
    one sofa
    one looking glass
    one table (dining table)

    Thus done and inventoried according to a statement of the servant of the deceased, Jeck, who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge, he has not withheld or secreted anything that belonged to the aforesaid estate

    In witness whereof I the Commissioner together with the appearer and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioner: F: Brand

    This is + the mark of said Jeck

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    Ampliation to the inventory of the estate of the late Jacobus Alexander Fhersen

    two wardrobes at Mr Usher
    two windows, curtains
    seven draught oxen at Mr F: Becker

    Cape Town, Cape of Good Hope, 10th of June, 1828

    This is + the mark of the aforesaid Jeck

    J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/43.7¶

    1) de oudste Andrita Wilmina
    2) Maria Elizabeth

    78 aanteelt bokken

    3 stoelen

    1 ketel

    NB een versleten ploeg

    schuld 1337 ryksd: zegge dertien honderd zeven en dertig ryksd:s

    {18281227} 27 December 1828 Joh:s Jac:s Theron

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Joh:s Jac:s Theron on the 24th day of the month of December in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight for the benefit of his mother Alida Adriana Mosterd wedow Joh:s Joachim Theron on the one, and his brother and sisters, namely

    1) Alida full aged on the other part
    2) Hendricus Tobias
    3) Anna Cath:a Hendrina
    4) Magdalena and
    5) Jacobus Theron /abroad/

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of the aforesaid heirs and been inventoried by the undersigned Commissioner of the Board aforesaid was found to consist in the following, viz:

    In a house belonging to Mrs Janfredrik Serrurier and G:W: Meyer as securities for the mortgages on said house, said house however still stands on the name of the deceased.

    to Christina Pepronella Neyhoff for monies lent on the 24 Dec:r 1828   130
    to Joh:s Joach:s Theron p:r natural law of the deceased claims for 20 months wages as having superintended the work done to the different buildings undertaken and completed by the deceased during that period and rd:s40 per month   800
    to the widow J:J: Theron p:r claims for and on behalf of her daughter Magdalena for monies lent   600
    aforesaid J:J: Theron S:r states that he things this claim has been fully paid and can be ascertained by the receipts to be found amongst the papers

    Thus inventoried in Cape Town on the 27 Decemb: 1828 according to a statement made by Catharina Petronella Neyhoff and Joh:s Joach:s Theron J:z and in the presence of the A:A: Mostad wed: Joh:s Joach: Theron Senior and Anna Catharina Hendrina Theron who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowledge they have not withheld or secreted anything that belonged to the aforesaid estate and the said appearer further declared that they are and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm their statement by solemn oath if requested, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered

    In witness whereof I the Commissioner with the appearers and me, the Secretary, have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioners: J: Marshall

    C:P: Neyhoff, J:J: Theron, J:r, de weduwe J:J: Theron, A:C: Theron

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    {18251014} 14 October 1825 Johan Wilhelm Ludwig Gebhardt

    Inventory of the property of the Rev:d Johan Wilhelm Ludwig Gebhart born in Manheim, relinquished by his death on the 12th day of the month of October in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty five at 6 o clock in the morning

    The deceased having by his last will and testament executed on the 26th September 1825 before the notary Reynier Beck and witnesses, appointed (after having bequeathed several legacies) his sole and universal heir his son Henry Gebhart, part of which inheritance amounting to forty thousand guilders is entailed with Fidei Commis and which Fidei Commis is subject to the conditions expressed in said will.

    And having further requested and appointed in the aforesaid will the worshipful board of Orphan Masters of this Colony, to be his executors and guardian of the said minor heir.

    In consequence of which the aforesaid property (after the seals of office has been removed) was duly inventoried by the undersigned Special Commissioners from the Orphan Board and was found to consist in the following

    A house and garden with the lands adjoining thereto, situated in thisat the foot of themeasuring 21 morgen 501 square roods and 102 square feet
    In the room at the right
    a sofa
    six chairs
    a looking glass
    In the dining room
    two looking glasses
    eight pictures
    a funnel
    a set of fire irons
    seven chairs defect
    two tables
    a green table cloth
    a trunk
    a writing desk
    a waggon box
    In the room to the left
    two feather beds
    nine pillows
    two blankets
    three coverlets
    a set of bed curtains
    four window curtains
    fourteen cushions
    one bedpan
    one blanket
    a wardrobe
    two sets of bed curtains
    two pictures
    a pendule
    a silver tumbler with cover, with the initials of the deceased
    some books of which a catalogue will be annexed hereunto
    five muds of corn belonging to the said Henry Gebhart
    the wearing apparel of the deceased left to his son for his use
    In the hall
    a passage lamp
    six plated candlesticks
    one pair of snuffers and stand
    one cruet stand defective
    one washhandbason and ewer
    one liquor stand
    two glass shades (defect)
    a tea caddy
    a rasor case containing three rasors
    a carving knife and fork
    four knives
    ten forks
    twelve desert plates
    four desert dishes
    a China tea service /defect/
    three salt cellars
    a blue tea set /defect/
    a coffee pot
    an old pipe
    a funnel
    twelve silver table spoons

    four silver tea spoons
    two silver forks
    three plated tea spoons
    one plated sugar tong
    a quantity of Delph plates and dishes
    a smoothing iron and stand
    seven decanters
    three and one half dozen of wine glasses
    one dozen of tumblers
    five jars
    a table

    a table
    a writing desk
    a chest
    a close stoel
    a looking glass

    a quantity of wine bottles

    Slaves
    a male slave named Frans of this Colony about 14 years of age
    a male slave named Dampie of this Colony about 53 years of age, labourer
    a male slave named Frans of this Colony about 11 years of age
    a male slave named Jephta of this Colony about 63 years of age, labourer in the service of the Rev: Scholtz
    a male slave named Leander of Bengal aged 63 years, labourer
    a male slave named December of Mosambique 31 years of age, labourer
    a female slave named Sara of this Colony about 54 years of age, housemaid in the service of the Rev:d Scholtz
    a female slave named Flora of this Colony about 54 years of age, housemaid
    a female slave named Clara n:o 1 of this Colony 33 years of age, housemaid slaves which are to be emancipated according to the last will and testament of the deceased
    a female slave named Sophia of this Colony 27 years of age, housemaid
    a female slave named Georgina child of Sophia born on the 30th June 1821
    a female slave named Spasie of this Colony aged 11 years and 10 months
    a female slave named Clara of this Colony child of Sophia born on the 26th July 1816
    a female slave named Louisa of this Colony child of Sophia born on the 7th February 1818
    a female slave named Betje child of Sophia baptized Elizabeth Catharina Francina born 9th October 1823
    Cash found in the estate
    twenty two rixdollars four shillings and four stivers
    Claims in favour of the estate
        Rd:s
    interest paid from 70000 up to 12 April last and from the remaining 60000 up to 31 October last ; 22 August 1825; 15 December 1826 paid on interest up to 31 October 1826 - origineele schuld bet:d tot Smuts 10 Maart 1827 from Hendrik Philip Beyers according to a mortgage bond dated 25th of May 1821 still amounting in capital 60000 or 20 000
      with the interest from the 1st November 1824
    interest paid up to 28 February 1828; 13 March 1828 from Willem Isaac Louw Hendriksson according to a notarial bond dated 8 April 1823 amounting to 31000 10333:16
      with the interest from 28 February 1825
    the vouchers to the abovementioned claims against Fredrik Kannemeyer, Hester Rossouw, Jan Nymans, the widow J:D: Hermans born Jordaan, Jan Christoffel Leeuwner, and P:P: Luttig H:son received by me this day, Orphan Chamber, Cape of Good Hope, this 15th October 1829 as witnesses, P: de Wet, P:E: Myburgh, H: Gebhart from Fredrik Kannemeyer on a note of hand dated 26 September 1820 147:--
    with the interest from 26 October 1820

    with the interest from 26 February 1822

    pro memoria, not to be called in before the 5th November 1829
    with the interest from 5th November 1824
    from Jan Christoffel Leewner on a notarial bond dated 12 March 1812 200:--
    with the interest since [ ..... ] from [ ..... ]
    from J:J: Luttig H:son on a note of hand dated 26 March 1824 40:--
    Claims against the estate
        Rd:s
      to Johanna Margaretha Wolff born Gebhardt an amount of rd:s340 per annum, according to a document dated 19 May 1825, of which mention has been made in the aforesaid last will and testament of the deceased  
      to the aforesaid female slave Clara an amount of 333:16
      bequeathed to her by said will  
    balance paid 21 Feb:y 28 to the aforesaid Sophia bequeathed to her as above an amount of 3000:--
      to the aforesaid Georgina 2000:--

      together bequeathed to her in said will under such conditions as therein stipulated 2500:--
    paid to the widow Van der Poel on a mortgage bond dated [ ..... ] amounting in capital to 21000 1000
      with the interest from [ ..... ]

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope on the 14th October 1825 according to a statement made by the son of the deceased Mr Henry Gebhardt who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge has not withheld or secreted anything that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement by solemn oath if required, promising that if after the date of these presents any property might be discovered he shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the Secretary and appearer have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioners: G:E: Overbeek, J:P: Munnik

    Hendrik Gebhart

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/43.10¶

    {18270420} 20 April 1827 William Henry Baulcomb

    Inventory all such property as have been relinquished by the death ab intestato of William Henry Baulcomb on the fifteenth day of the month of April in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven for the benefit of his unknown foreign heirs.

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of the aforesaid unknown foreign heirs and been inventoried by the undersigned special Commissioners of the Board aforesaid was found to consist in the following articles, viz:t

    In the house belonging to Government situated at the upper end of the Government Garden

    In the front room
    four chairs
    a canopy
    a writing desk and stool
    a table
    a wardrobe containing
    a shooting jacket
    a frock coat
    eight waist coats
    a p:r trowsers
    a pillow case
    a cap
    six pr:s socks and stockings
    a pad
    a book
    memorandum: the Government slave Claas formerly in the service of the deceased states that there are some linen with the washerwoman Flora a list of which will be subjoined hereafter
    two flower pots
    a shoe horse
    a small rack
    In a room behind
    a table
    a common table
    a close stool
    a large basket containing
    one nightgown
    two shawls
    two towels
    two shirts
    four sheets
    two counterpanes
    one blanket
    In the pantry
    a table
    a chest
    a coffy mill
    a water tub
    three sauce pans
    two dishes
    one plate
    a bason
    a cup and saucer
    a jar
    four empty bottles
    In the kitchen
    a kettle
    a tripod
    a frying pan
    a pair bellows
    a smoothing iron
    a pepper box
    a p:r sugar nippers
    a sauce pan
    a spade
    Up stairs
    an old bedstead and horsehair mattress
    a gun /double barrel defective/
    a bird cage
    a bedet
    some lumber
    Memorandum: according to m:r George Manalaus Paines statement Mr Francis Collison has in his hands belonging to the estate a sum of between r:d:s2300 and 2400
    Mr Twentyman one gold and one silver watch

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope in the house aforesaid on the twentieth day of the month of April in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven according to a statement made by the said George Manalaus Paine who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted anything that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and the said appearer further declared that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall and will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof I the Commissioner together with the appearer and the Chief Clerk of the Orphan Chamber have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioner: D: Kuys

    G:M: Paine

    In my presence: J: Serrurier

    three towels
    four shirts
    four waistcoats
    three towels
    three handkerchiefs
    four p:rs stockings
