    MOOC8/44.7¶

    {18250405} 5 April 1825 Frans Rynhard Bresler Maria Elizabeth Brink

    Inventory of the joint property of Frans Rynhard Bresler Esq:re late member of the worshipful the Court of Justice and his wife Maria Elizabeth Brink formerly widow to Mr Jacobus Christoffel de Wit relinquished by the death of the firstmentioned on the twenty eighth day of March in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty five at [ ..... ] o clock in the morning. The deceased having by his last will and testament executed jointly with his aforesaid wife on the 11:th August 1825 before the Notary Franciscus Xaverius Lind and witnesses instituted and appointed his sole and universal heirs his wife Maria Elizabeth Brink aforesaid together with his two children procreated in former marriage by his first wife Sara Brand, named

    1) Sara Catharina Bresler married to Johannes Christiaan Coetzee in equal shares
    2) Christoffel Casparus Bresler

    And further by his aforesaid will and testament requested and appointed the worshipful Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony to be and to act as his executors.

    In consequence of which the aforesaid property (after the seals of office has been removed) was duly inventoried by the undersigned special commissioners from the Orphan Board and was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    A house and erf situated in this,
    a house and erf on theN:B: the said house is at present divided in two
    an erf situated in thebeing a part of the Freemasons garden called de
    an erf situated in thebeing a part of the Freemasons garden called de
    In the passage
    a lamp
    two couches
    In the room to the right
    five window curtains
    two looking glasses
    two pictures
    a couch
    fourteen chairs
    five dumbwaiters
    one sopha table
    five card tables
    one [card tables]
    one table clock
    five green table cloths
    one carpet
    six stoves
    a card box
    In the room to the left
    a window curtain
    a looking glass
    five pictures
    a table
    a card table
    a couch
    two arm chairs
    twelve chairs
    two dumbwaiters
    a small round table
    a secretaire
    a shaving box
    in the abovementioned secretaire
    some Massonnical decorations
    four spectacles which the children of the deceased request may be left unsold and given to the surviving widow
    a sigar case
    a traveling spoon, knife and fork
    a silver hunting watch with gold chain, two gold seals and key which the widow as well as the children declare to have been given by the deceased as a present to his grandson Frans Rynhard Johannes Bresler
    a pair of plated shoe buckles
    a ruler
    a remainder of writing paper
    In the hall
    a window curtain
    four lamps
    one side board
    two halfround tables
    one tea [tables]
    twelve chairs

    five aums
    two halfaums
    Slaves
    a male slave named Adam of the Cape , labourer, aged 49 years
    a male slave named Basta from the coast of Cormandel, labourer, aged 55 years this slave can only be sold to the heirs of the estate of the proprietor and is always to remain in the family and never to be allianated to strangers as appears by two codicils dated 26 December 1805 and 26 January annexed to the testament of the mother of the deceased the late Sara Dreyer widow of the late Joh:s Bresler bearing dated 2:d February 1796
    a male slave named Jan of this Colony, carpenter, aged 23 years under the same conditions as above
    a male slave named Adonis of this Colony, labourer, aged 39 years
    a male slave named Jack cook ofaged 45 years
    a male slave named January of Mosambique , houseboy, aged 44 years
    a male slave named Izaak of this Colony, tailor, aged 29 years
    a male slave named Dick of this Colony, tailor, aged 25 years to be manumitted after the death of the survivor Mrs Maria Elizabeth Brink widow of the deceased
    a male slave named Charles of this Colony aged 12 years
    a male slave named Joemat of this Colony aged 11 years
    a male slave named Samuel born on the 27:t of April 1821
    a female slave named Amilie aged 65 years
    a female slave named Roosje of Batavia aged 59 years
    a female slave named Fredrica of this Colony, servant made, aged 25 years and her child Anna born on the 30 July 1827 these female slaves as well as their children, can only be sold to the heirs of the estate of the proprietor and are always to remain in the family and never to be allianated to strangers as appears by the testament of the above late widow Joh:s Bresler
    a female slave named Philida of this Colony, servant made, aged 15 years
    a female slave named Amilie of this Colony, servant made, aged 15 years
    a female slave named Charlotta of this Colony, servant made, aged 13 years
    a female slave named Satira of this Colony about 10 years of age
    Cash found in the estate
    seventeen rixdollars paper currency
    Claims in favour of the estate
        Rd:s Rd:s
    paid 13 June 1829 from Jacobus Bosman by a notarial bond dated 31 August 1819 amounting to   2600:--
      interest since the 31:t of August 1823
    paid 20 Octob: 1826 from Herman Schutte by a notarial bond dated 13:t November 1819 amounting to   2000:--
    interest since the 6:t of November 1822
    paid 2:d March 1830 from Joachim Wilhelm Stoll by a mortgage bond dated 5:th November 1819 amounting to   3000:--
    interest since the 8:t June 1824
      from the widow Claris as appears by a notarial deed dated 12 August 1820 passed before the Notary Mr J:P: de Wet and certain witnesses, amounting to   1289:16
    interest paid up to 21 Novemb: 1825 from Mrs the widow E: Gumbeck by a note of hand dated 21 February 1812 amounting   200:--
      interest since the 21:t November 1824
    paid from the widow Coenraad Nelson being the balance of a notarial bond dated 26 August 1815 amounting to   229:--
    interest from the 9:t of February 1821
    paid from the Freemasons Lodge called the Good Hope by a note of hand dated 21 August 1821 amounting to   600:--
    interest since the 21:t August 1823
    paid 19 Dec:r 1829 from Sir J:A: Truter by a note of hand dated 18 July 1815 amounting to   530:12
    interest from 18 July 1815
    paid Februarij 1827 from Mr Gettir Buyskes being the amount paid on his account to E: Buyskes as security of the said Gerrit Buyskes amounting to   100:--
    paid June 1825 from Johannes de Wit by a note of hand dated 23 May 1820 amounting to   200:--
      from J: Ulrich on a promissory note dated 3 February last due on the 15:t of March last   425:--
      from Casparus Johannes Rynhard Bresler by a note of hand dated 23 July 1823   233:--
      from Major M:G: Blake on a promissory note dated 2:d September 1815 amounting to   2100:--
      from J:H:A: Falck on a note of hand dated 24 June 1812 amounting to   200:--
      from the woman Julinda by a note of hand dated 13:t December 1813, per balance   100:--
      from Carel Meyer on a note of hand dated 13 January 1813   40:--
      from the widow Chompel Hertz per balance of her account   657:42
    paid by Mr Robbertson to the deceased according to his books from Joseph Dayot (being abroad) being the balance due by him to the deceased and Mr A:G: van Kervel rd:1167:32 and consequently in favour of the deceased   538:40
      from the carpenter J: Ulrich for hire of a slave boy named Jan since the 1:t of January last at 40 rd: per month   117:16
      from Valentyn (tailor) the balance due by him for hire of a slave boy named Dick up to 31:t December 1824 20:--
      also from the 1:t of January last for hire of said boy at rd:40 per month 117:16 137:16
    paid 21 Octob: 1826 from the mason Herman Schutte the balance of his account for hire of a mason and two labourers up to the 31 Decemb:r 1824 1004:--
    also for the hire of two labourers at forty rixd:s per month from 1 January last 117:16 1121:16
      from Christiaan Fisscher (mason) for hire of January from 1:st of January at 32 rix:s per month 93:42
      from Christiaan Fisscher (mason) for hire of two labourers at 36 rd: per month from the said period 105:29 199:23
    paid April 1825 from Mrs the widow Clariss houserent from the 1:t of March last at rd:s55 per month   111:36
    paid Aug:t 1826 from Mr W: Hewetson houserent from the 1:t March last at rd:85 per month   170:--
      from Government his salary   1015:12
    Debts of the estate
        Rd:s Rd:s
    settled November 1825 to Mr J:H: Neethling by a notarial bond amounting to 6000   2000
    interest from the 18 of July 1824
      to the Orphan Chamber by two mortgage bonds dated 31 July 1805 and 5 March 1819 amounting to 15000 or   5000
      interest from 1 January 1825
    paid October 1826 to the Discount Bank on a promissory note dated 1:t December 1823 expired on the 1:t March 1824   2150
    interest from 1:t March 1824
    paid 10 April 1828 to Ryno Joh:s van der Riet on a note of hand amounting to 1500   500
    interest from [ ..... ]
    paid 15:th Julij 1828 to the Lombard Bank by a mortgage bond dated 23 February 1821   2000
    interest from 1 January 1824
    paid November 1825 to Gerrit Hendrik Meyer by a note of hand dated [ ..... ] amounting to 3000   1000
      interest from 14 April 1824
    paid 13:th September 1825 to the estate of Mrs the widow W: Vrugt 3000   1000
    interest from 8:t of May 1824
    settled 20 March 1829 to A: Richert by a mortgage bond dated 24:t Novemb:r amounting to 21000 or   7000
    interest from the 24:t November 1824
    paid 25 April 1828 to Miss Hester C: Brandt by a note of hand dated 1:t April 1822 amounting to   300
    interest from the 1 April 1824
    settled 20 March 1829 to Missus the widow Clariss by a note of hand dated 21:t February 1806 amounting to 1276
      to Missus the widow Clariss by a note of hand dated 1:t of October 1811 amounting to 500
      to Missus the widow Clariss by a note of hand dated 15:t Maart 1821 230 2006
    paid 1825 Sept: rd:2000, 1825 Dec: rd:3000 to M: Bicker junior being the balance of sundry China goods sold by the survivor as formerly widow of the late Jac:s Christ:l de Wet   5000

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope in the firstmentioned house on the 5:t, 7:t and 8:th days of the month of April in the year one thousand eight hundred and twenty five according to a statement made by the aforesaid widow and children of the deceased, who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowlegde and that they have not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate, the said appearers further declared that they are and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm their statement by solemn oath if required promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discoverd they shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order that this inventory may be amplified with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearers and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioners: G:E: Overbeek, J: Kuys

    M:E: Bresler geb: Brink, J:C: Kotz, C:C: Bresler

    In mij presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    Catalogus van boeken behorende tot den boedel van wylen den wel: ed: heer F:R: Bresler

    MOOC8/44.8¶

    {18281106} 6 November 1828 Helena Catharina Krugel

    Friday 28 Nov: 1828

    Inventory of all such property as have been relinquished by the death of Helena Catharina Krugel formerly married to Pieter Roux and now separated wife of the late reverend Johan Wilhelm Ludwich Gebhard on the fifth day of the month of November in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight.

    The testatrice having by her last will and testament executed on the 13 July 1826 before the Notary Public Rynier Beck and certain witnesses after having bequeathed several legacies appointed as her sole and universal heirs, namely

    1) Maria Wilhelmina de Waal widow John Pigott Watney /deceased/ in the one, and
    2) her children, named Pieter Watney and on the other part
    Maria Josina Christina Watney

    and in the event of their demise their lawfull descendents by representation and has further in aforesaid will appointed the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony to be and to act as her executors administrators and guardian over the minor heirs.

    In consequence of which the aforesaid property has been duly inventoried by the inventoried by the undersigned special Commissioners from the Orphan Board and was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    A house and erf situated in
    a sofa
    a tea table
    a silver tea urn
    a silver bason
    a silver teapot
    two silver trays
    a silver melkpot
    a silver soup ladle
    twelve silver spoons
    twelve silver forks
    four silver tea spoons
    a carpet
    two foot stools
    a standing watch
    two silver candlesticks
    one silver sugar pot
    In the hall
    one dining table
    eight chairs
    a small cubboard
    two decanters
    a butter pot
    two sweetmeat pots
    ten cups and saucers
    ten soup plates
    twelve plates
    four covered dishes
    a soup turien
    eight dishes
    eleven knives
    twenty four forks
    a coffy pot
    two salt cellars
    five glasses
    four wine glasses
    Up stairs
    two bed steads
    one stretcher
    one looking glass
    an easy stool
    three bedings complete
    a washhand stand
    one large chest
    one table
    In the kitchen
    a table
    four pots
    one pan
    two pails
    a soup ladle
    a grid iron
    as also, a gold snuff box bequeathed to the aforesaid Pieter Watney
    a ward robe bequeathed to the aforesaid Miss [ ..... ] Watney
    a white shall bequeathed to Mrs Anna Elizabeth Catharina Verschuur wife of aforesaid P:r Watney
    a red shall bequeathed to the aforesaid Miss [ ..... ] Watney, the clothes of the deceased and linnen to be divided between Miss [ ..... ] Watney and Mrs Watney aforesaid
    Slaves of the estate
      Januarij of Mosambique 52 y:s of age, labourer
    emancipated Decemb: 1828 Meford of Batavia about 44 y:s of age to be emancipated according to a codicil dated 26 Septemb: 1828
      Gerrit of this Colony 16 y:s of age bequeathed according to a codicil dated 26 Septemb: 1824 to the aforesaid P: Watney
      Matthys of this Colony 14 y: of age bequeathed as above to Miss [ ..... ] Watney
    emancipated Decemb: 1828 Eva 14 y:s of age   to be emancipated according to a codicil dated 26 Septemb: 1824
    Betje born 4 April 1819
    Jane born 15 May 1817
    Rachel of this Colony 46 y:s   to be emancipated according to a codicil dated 19 July 1826
    Rebecca of this Colony with her children Carel b:n 6 Sep: 1821
    Meford born 8 Octob: 1823
    emancipated Decemb: 1828 Martha of this Colony 48 y:s of age to be emancipated according to said codicil of 19 July 1824
    not Rachel of this Colony 21 y:s of age with her two children Moos born [ ..... ]
    Meford born 17 Oct: 1828
    Claims in favor of the estate
        Rd:s
    taken over bij the Orphan Chamber in behalf of Maria Josina Christina Watneij from Willem Izaak Louw on a mortgage bond dated 27 January 1826 amounting to 30840 10280:--
      interest from 1:st March
    paid the capital with interest, 17 Jan:ry 1829; produced a receipt that the interest is paid to 17 January 1829 from Hermanus Lambertus Bosman on a notarial bond dated 31 January 1824 10000 3333:16
      interest since 17 January 1828
    paid 19 July 1824 from Andries Jacobus Burgers on a notarial bond dated 9 June 1823 864:--
    interest since 25 July
    according to a receipt produced the interest was paid up to 28 Feb:y 1828; ceded and transported to Pieter Watney, 31 Decemb: 1828 from William Duckett on a notarial bond dated 26 March 1823 amounting in capital per balance 5400:--
    interest since 28 Feb:y 1828
    capital and interest paid 13 Aug:t 1829 from Johan Martin Guslin on a notarial bond dated 15 March 1823 1600:--
    interest since 28 Feb:y 1828
      from Johannes Nicolaas Hausman on a notarial bond dated 2 May 1823 amounting to r:1400 which bond has been bequeathed by said will of 13 July 1826 to him the same Hausman [ ..... ]
    Claims against the estate
        Rd:s
    paid 5:th June 1829 to Maria Elizabeth Hausman wid: of Jacobus Coenradie as a legacy according to the aforesaid will 5000 1666:32
    paid 16 Januarij 1829 to Pieter Eduard Hauman as a legacy according to the aforesaid will 5000 1666:32
    paid 17 Sep:r 1829 the Reformer Church in this town 500:--
    paid 7:th March the Missionary Society in this town 500:--
    received six months interest up to the 5:th instant, 8 May 1829 to Helena Catharina Krugel widow of Johannes Jacobus Jacobs as a legacy according to the aforesaid will entailing with fidei commis 1000:--
    paid 15:th October 1824 to the church at theon condition that the tombe in which her remains will be placed shall be kept in proper state of repair according to the aforesaid will 1000 333:16
      to Pieter Watney as an equivalent for a ward robe bequeathed to Miss Watney 200:--
    Cash found in the estate
      Rd:s
    one thousand five hundred rix dollar /say/ 1500

    Thus done and inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope on the 6:th of Novemb: 1828 at the house aforesaid according to a statement made by Miss [ ..... ] Watney and Pieter Watney who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowledge they have not withheld or secreted any thing that belongs to the aforesaid estate, promising at the same time if after the date of these presents any property belonging to the said estate might be discovered, will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearers and me the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commissioners: J: Brand, C: Blankenberg

    P: Watney, M: Watney

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/44.9¶

    {18250915} 15 September 1825 Harry Muggridge

    d: 15 Sep: 1825

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Harry Muggridge on the twelfth day of the month of September in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty five for the benefit of his surviving widow Helena Johanna Sporkman on the one and his two minor children begotten in a former marriage with Martha Grainger, named

    1) Carolina Martha born on the 4:th May 1810 on the other part
    2) Henry Muggridge born on the 25 June 1813

    The aforesaid property having been inventoried by the undersigned Commissioners from the Board of Orphan Masters, according to a statement made by aforesaid widow and was found to consist in the following, viz:

    In the passage
    one table with a green cloth
    fifteen chairs
    one easy [chairs]
    In the front room
    one window curtain
    four pictures
    one table with a blue cloth
    one sofa
    one ward robe
    one small glass case
    a time piece
    one brass fander
    one small case of mathematical instruments
    a brase bits compleat
    three pair of plyers
    a small pair of scales

    two arrows

    Thus inventoried in Cape Town, Cape of Good Hope on the 15 Septemb: 1825 according to a statement made by the aforesaid widow and George Muggridge who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowledge they have not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate. And the said appearers further declared that they are and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm their statement by solem oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered, shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearers and me the Secretary have subscribed to these presents

    As Commissioners: J: Kuys, J: Horne

    Helena Johanna Muggridge geboren Sporkman, George Belam Muggridge

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/44.10a¶

    {18280621} 21 June 1828 Thomas Lawson

    Inventory of the goods and effects belonging to the intestate estate of Thomas Lawson born inlate Resident Magistrate of the district ofwho died at his residence inon the morning of Thursday the 19:th June one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight aged about forty five years having no relation in this Colony

    Inmovable
     
    A house situated informerly the property of Richard Harvey and lately sold by the trustees of his estate and purchased by Henry Ulyate on account of the deceased on the 7:th day of June 1828 104

    1 hair trunk 1:--:--
      in the trunk was found a bag containing
      12 pieces of rd:s50 each 45:--:--
      1 piece of sth:s4 0:0:9
      British silver money 2:17:6
      British copper money 0:0:6
    Outstanding debts
     
    Mr John George de Villiers acknowledges to be indebted to the estate for the purchase of a chair, a ladies working box, etc:a, etc:a, etc:a 8:7:6
    amount due to the deceased from the Colonial Government for salary as resident magistrate offrom the 1:st April to 18:th June 1828 108:6:8
    Amount 732:3:11

    Seven hundred thrity two pounds, three shillings and eleven pence sterling.

    Thus done, inventory taken and appraised atin the district ofon Saturday the 21:st day of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight.

    As witnesses: B: Wienand jun:r, John Willis

    J:G: de Villiers, Agent

    We the undersigned chosen appraisers for the intestate estate of the late Thomas Lawson Esquire do hereby make oath and declare that the foregoing estimate is to the best of our knowledge and belief a just and proper valuation.

    21:st June 1828

    Don: Moodie

    C: Mill, L:t Colonel

    Sworn before me aton the 26:th June 1828

    W:B: Dundas, C:l Commissioner

    List of claims recieved by the Agent to the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony against the intestate estate of the late Thomas Lawson, Esquire, Resident Magistrate of

         
    paid 41:5 N:o 1 George Watson, undertaker bill for funeral expences 41:5:--
    settled vide account current of the Agent N:o 2 Benjamin Norden, licenced auctioneer, the amount of the purchase money of the house mentioned in the inventory 104:--:--
      N:o 3 Benjamin Norden, by vendue account of goods purchased on the 2:nd June 1828 2:6:2
    paid 206:10 N:o4 G:F: Stokes, licenced auctioneer by vendue account for goods purchased on the 16:th, 17:th and 18:th of June 1828 206:--:--
    paid Ap:l 1829 N:o 5 C: and H: Maynard, by account 14:11:--
    paid N:o 6 George Watson, carpenters account 1:10:--
      N:o 7 W:R: Thompson, shop account 3:8:3
    paid N:o 8 P: Heugh and Co:, shop account 4:2:6
    paid N:o 9 Stone and Hidwell, shop account 3:7:6
    paid Ap:l 1829 7:17:4 N:o 10 James Howse, by account 8:2:6
    paid N:o 11 Forbes Still, by account 6:10:6
    11 June 29 paid N:o 12 George McLachlan, by account 8:15:6
    11 June 29 paid N:o 13 Charles Webber, by account 19:8:--
      N:o 14 William Edward Smith, by account 0:6:--
        Total am:t received by Agent up to 26 June 1828 423:12:11

    J:G: de Villiers, Agent

    Thursday the 19 June 1828

    The death of Thomas Lawson, Resident Magistrate for the district ofhaving been reported to me, the undersigned John George de Villiers Agent to the Board of Orphan Masters at, I at 7 oclock this morning repaired to the residence of the deceased (the same being a Government house situated in this town) and after having caused all boxes etc:a, etc:a belonging to the estate /or supposed to belong to the same/ to be placed in a room, did agreeably to my instructions, seal the doors of said room as well as the window shutters with the district seal, in presence of William Bolden Dundas Esquire, Civil Commissioner ofandand lieutenant colonel Mill of His Majestys 55:th Regiment now stationed on the frontier, the latter having been particularly acquainted with the deceased who is Thomas Lawson, about 45 years of age, born in, whose father is also named Thomas Lawson and supposed to reside atin(nearin Vife)

    Thus done and sealed at19 June 1828

    In our presence: W: B: Dundas, C:l Commissioner

    J: G: de Villiers, Agent

    The same day Thursday the 19 June 1828

    I further caused all the doors and window shutters of the dwelling house and outbuildings to be closed and sealed preparatory to making search for a will /if any/ or taking an inventory of the estate which was fixed for Saturday next the 21:st instant at 11 oclock a:m:, major Dundas and colonel Mill having engaged to be present.

    As witnesses: B: Wienand jun:r, John Willis

    J:G: de Villiers, Agent

    Saturday 21:st June 1828

    Major Dundas having been called from home on duty, I the undersigned Agent, accompanied by Donald Moodie Esq:r and lieutenant colonel Mill proceeded to the house of the deceased and on examining the seals found the same to be safe and unbroken and having caused them to be taken off commenced a search for a will but none being found the effects were taken under inventory and appraised by the said Donald Moodie Esq:r and lieutenant colonel Mill, in manner as stated in the inventory hereunto annexed.

    Thus done at21:st June 1828

    As witnesses: B: Wienand jun:r, John Willis

    J:G: de Villiers, Agent

    MOOC8/44.10b¶

    {18281210} 10 December 1828 Thomas Lawson

    Exh:d the 17 December 1828 n:o 13

    Inventory of the contents of a box addressed to Thomas Lawson Esq:r Resident Magistrate atframed by the undersigned ommissioned members of the Orphan Chamber

    1 counterpane
    12 napkins
    6 towels
    6 sheets
    4 pillow cases
    2 pillow coarser
    4 bolster cases
    5 table cloths, damask
    1 table diaper
    1 picture in black frame
    1 picture, a profile
    1 small paper box containing common glass beads and a few pewter toys
    1 book of the Psalms
    1 book an Inaugural Dissertation by A:B: Chisholm
    1 small gold seal
    1 silk purse
    1 gold watch key
    sundry old newspapers
    1 old leather valisse

    Orphan Chamber Cape of Good Hope the 10:th December 1828

    C: Blanckenberg

    W:m Hayward

    Mr Smuts, Secretary to the Orphan Chamber will please deliver to the bearer Mr Richard Clarance one of our assistant the box belonging to the late Thomas Lawson with a list of its contents

    Borradaely Thompson, 2 Pillars

    Cape Town, 27 June 1829

    MOOC8/44.11a¶

    {18271022} 22 October 1827 Charles Johannes van Helsland Jeanette Francoise Duminy

    Inventory taken at the place calledsituated along thein the district ofof all such property of Charles Johannes van Helsland and Jeanette Francoise Duminy relinquished by the death of the firstmentioned on the thirteenth day of the month of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven. The deceased having by his last will and testament executed jointly with his aforesaid wife on the 1:st May 1827 before the Notary Public Mr Jacobus Petrus de Wet and witnesses, appointed his brothers and sisters abroad as his sole and universal heirs or their descendants with this condition however that the testatrix shall enjoy the interest thereof during her life time and after her death to devolve on his aforesaid brothers and sisters. And has further requested in said will the Board of Orphan Masters to be and to act as executors of the said will and guardians over his abovementioned minor heirs, in consequence whereof the undersigned commissioned members of the Orphan Board have taken the estate under proper inventory and found the same to consist in the following

    A house and premises in Cape Town, the before mentioned place, a perpetual quitrent place called, a piece perpetual quitrent land adjoining the place, as also all the slaves and a part of the property belonging to the estate has been already inserted in the inventory taken in Cape Town

    At the aforesaid place.

    In the passage
    five tables, sorted
    twelve chairs
    a mahogany wine case
    thirteen pictures
    three oval pictures
    three window curtains
    a watch rack
    a tea box
    four flower pots
    a hand bell
    In the front room to the right
    a looking glass
    a washand stand
    a water jug and bason
    seven pictures
    a bedstead with curtains
    two feather beds
    two mattrass
    two bolster
    eight pillows
    a blancket
    a toilette
    two chamber pots
    a green table cloth
    five small [table cloth]
    In the front room to the left
    a stitcher
    a canapy of a bedstead with curtain
    a mattrass
    two pillows
    a chamber pot
    a clothes rack
    a washand jug and bason
    a ward robe
    in a cupboard of the same room
    a silver waiter
    a silver tea pot and stand
    a silver milk jug
    a silver tea strainer
    a silver cruet stand
    twenty four silver table spoons
    ten silver forks
    fifteen tea spoons
    two silver sweetmeat forks
    a silver tea spoon
    a silver soup ladle
    two silver gravy spoons
    a silver fish knife
    two silver butter knives
    a silver egg stand
    a silver marrow spoon
    a plated tea pot with silver edges and stand
    a plated sugar pot
    a plated milk jug
    a plated sugar tongs
    a plated mustard pot
    a plated salt celler
    a plated lequor stand with silver edges
    six plated candlesticks
    six plated decanter stands
    two pair of snuffers and stands
    four cut glass decanters
    two cut glass water decanters

    five pint decanters
    two glass sweetmeat pots
    two glass butter pots
    two glass salt sellers

    twelve tumblers

    In the waggon house

    a boat rope
    In the distillery
    two brandy stills
    three coolers
    Upstears in the house
    three drawers
    two flour casks

    a waggon box
    two large trunks
    a chest
    ten boxed of sorts
    On the outside
    two ladders
    a watering pot

    a crow bar
    six spades
    two shovels
    three wooden rakes
    six wooden forks /gaffels/
    a [ ..... ] /hoos/
    twelve sickles
    two corn shovels
    six wine bocks
    two ploughs
    a harrow
    fifty two geese
    In the crawl
    twelve waggon horses
    forty one breeding mares
    a [breeding mares] by Mr N: Linde
    a [breeding mares] at the place
    a saddle horse
    twenty nine draught oxen
    thirty five breeding cattle
    two bulls
    seven hundred and thirty Spannish sheep
    one hundred and five goats

    Thus inventoried at the aforesaid place calledon the twenty second day of the month of October in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven according to a statement made by the survivor and Mr Benjamin Jacob Wilhelm Duminy who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of their knowledge they have not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate and the said appearers further declared that they are and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm their statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered, shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber, in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearers and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commissioners: J:F: Munnik, J: Horne

    De weduwe J: van Helsland geb:n Duminij, B:n Duminij

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    MOOC8/44.11b¶

    {18270517} 17 May 1827 Charles Johannes van Helsland Jeannette Francoise Duminy

    Inventory of all such property of Charles Johannes van Helsland and Jeannette Francoise Duminy relinquished by the death of the firstmentioned on the thirteenth day of the month of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven. The deceased having by his last will and testament executed jointly with his aforesaid wife on the 1:st May 1827 before the Notary Public Mr Jacobus Petrus de Wet and witnesses, appointed his brothers and sisters abroad as his sole and universal heirs or their decendants with this condition however that the testatrix shall enjoy the interest thereof during her life time and after her death to devolve on his aforesaid brothers and sisters. And has further requested in said will the Board of Orphan Masters to be and to act as executors of the said will and guardians over his abovementioned minor heirs, in consequence whereof the undersigned commissioned members of the Orphan Board have taken the estate under proper inventory and found the same to consist in the following, viz:t

    A house and erf situated in the
    a perpetual quitrent place calledsituated along the riverdistrict of
    a perpetual quitrent place calledsituated at thealso in the district of
    a piece perpetuated quitrent land with wood and timber growing thereon annex the place

    In the house of Mr Francois de Lettre where the deceased died

    a piano forte
    a ward robe
    a bureau with a book case thereupon
    twelve chairs
    a card table
    a round table with a marble stone
    a table clock
    two bureaus
    an old sedan chair
    a writing desk
    a chamber pot
    a small table
    a gold watch
    Slaves
    left to the widow a male slave named Moses of this Colony, houseboy, 62 years
      a male slave named Louis of Mosambique , cook, 60 years
      a male slave named Corrim of Mosambique , labourer, 35 years
    left to the widow a male slave named Sephier of this Colony, houseboy, 28 years
    left to the widow a male slave named Azemir of this Colony, houseboy, 20 years
    left to the widow a male slave named Lafleur of this Colony, houseboy, 19 years
    left to the widow a male slave named November of this Colony, houseboy, 16 years
      a male slave named Joaqui of this Colony, houseboy, 16 years
    left to the widow a male slave named Johadyn of this Colony, houseboy, 14 years
      a male slave named Canary of Mosambique , labourer, 54 years
      a male slave named Amady of Mosambique , shepherd, 44 years
      a male slave named Fortuin of Mosambique herdsman, 34 years
      a male slave named Dimanche of Madagascar , horsekeeper, 30 years
      a male slave named Johan of this Colony, houseboy, 13 years
    left to the widow by appraisement a female slave named Anette of this Colony, sempstress, 44 years with her children, named Carel (commonly called by his mother Nazarr ) born on the 15 January 1820
      Sathia born on the 16 October 1822 and
      Angeliek born on the [ ..... ] April 1825 - with regard however to the latter it is stated that this child has been erroneously stated to be a girl and that therefore Gouvernment has been memorialized to rectify the error and to call him Orea
    left to the widow a female slave named Sophie of this Colony, housemaid, 28 years sickly
    left to the widow a female slave named Bitja of this Colony, 11 years
      a female slave named Colette of Mosambique , housemaid, 42 years

    This hereby noticed that a separate inventory will be framed of the property at the aforesaid place

    Claims in favor of the estate
        Rd:s
    claim filed in the meeting of his creditors held 28 September 1829 from Pieter Human the purchase money of a piece of land being part of the aforesaid placeaccording to the conditions of sale dated 1 December 1825 4000 or 1333:16 the said P:r Joh:s Human has executed a mortgage bond on the 8 July 1828 for the purchase money to the amount of 100 1 January 1828
      from different persons for the grazing of their cattle and other different articles supplied of which a specific list will be added to this inventory
    Claims against the estate
       
    partlij paid and parthlij taken over bij Jacobus Theunissen in November 1825 with the interest to the Lombard Bank per balance due on two capitals amounting to 186:5
    interest from 1:st January 1826
    paid 22:d November 1828 with the interest to Willem Adriaan Wentzel according to a mortgage bond dated 27 April 1810 4333 1444:16
    taken over bij Jacobus Theunissen 21:st November 1828 to Daniel Krynauw 4000 or 1333:16
    interest from [ ..... ]
    paid 12:th Februarij 1828, with the interest to Dr Van Oosterzee according to a note of hand dated 30 August 1822 1000:--
    interest from 30:th August 1825
    paid 15:th March 1830 to Dr Van Oosterzee according to a note of hand dated 20 August 1824 per balance 1000 or 333:16
    to Dr Van Oosterzee according to a note of hand dated 1 December 1826 200:--
    to Benjamin Duminy as per account

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope in the house aforesaid on the seventeenth day of the month of May in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven according to a statement made by the survivor who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of her knowledge she has not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate, and the said appearer further declared that she is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm her statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearer and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commissioners: G:E: Overbeek, J:F: Munnik

    De wed: of J:F: van Helsland g:b Duminij

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

        Rd:s
    N: Linde bestant een tegen reken: 20 M:t 1828, paid 174:0:4
    P: Human niet betaald 190:5:--
    Gert Visser in titel te geven op versoek van de wed:e 77:--:--
    Christ: Neethling F:z moet worden geinformeerd of Neethling apothekers rekening te Stellenbosch heeft betaald 42:3:2

        Rd:s934:5:2

    Bovenstaande rekeningen aan my ter invordering afgegeven met uitzondering van den van O: en W: Bergh en C: Roode, met belofte daarvan verantwoord en aande welken te zullen doen wanneer de commissie die verkoping den boedels van wylen C:J: van Helsland zal oorgeeven ter plaatze alwaar de verkoping gehouden zal werden, zal aankomen

    Weeskamer den 17 July 1827

    B: Duminij

    Lyst van verkochte en nog onvoldaane articulen voor rekening des boedels van wylen den heere C:J: van Helslandt, viz:t

        over het geen zyn ed: by afreekening is schuldig gebleeven voor t jaar 1823 24:1:--

    den h:r W: Duminy word by deze gequalificeerd bovenstaande rekening ten behoeve van den boeden van wylen C:J: van Helsland intevorderen. Weeskamer den 17 July 1827.

    J:J:L: Smuts

    De slavin genaamd Sophie behorende tot den boedel van nu wijlen den heer Ch:s van Helslandt is van eene zeer ziekelijke gesteldheid in heeft door een borstkwaal dikwijls gevaar gelopen om een long tering te krijgen, tot welke aandoening zij bij voortduring eene geneigdheid blyft behouden.

    J: Knockers van Oosterzee, Med: Olst D:r

    Kaapstad den 16 Mei 1827

    Openstaande Reekening over het weiden van vhee, voor de jaaren 1817, 1818, 1819, 1820, 1821, 1822, 1823

    MOOC8/44.12¶

    {18230922} 22 September 1823 Roedolf Lubbe s:r

    H:V: Cloete

    A true and perfect inventory of all and every the goods, chattels, wares and merchandise as well moveable as not, debts, credits and other personal estate and effects of Roedolf Lubbe s:r the deceased who died at,July 3:rd 1823 about 3 o clock a:m: within the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, district ofwho died intestate and given up as follows

    male slave Pasense
    female slave Rachael
    female slave Spaas and her child Spaas
    1 bull
    7 oxen
    6 cows
    2 calves
    177 breeding sheep
    40 breeding goats
    1 spade
    1 old saw
    1 adze
    small assortment of old iron
    2 razors
    1 pair scissars
    1/4 lb: thread, etc:a
    2 iron pots
    1 brass chamber
    1 tea kettle
    1 bit handle
    Ready money
    nihil
    Creditors in favor of the estate
    erfgen: from Jan Lubbe Roedolfs son, residing in the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, district of, the sum of four hundred rix dollars, arising from the legacy of my late father, of the female slave Eva , whereof the document of legacy is the only bond
    erfg: from Gideon Rudolf Lubbe, Rudolfs son, residing in the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, the sum of two hundred rix dollars arising from money lent, whereof there is no bond
    erfg:25 63 bewijs from Gideon Rudolf Lubbe Roedolfs son, residing inn the field cornetship of David Stephannus Forie, district of, the sum of sixty three rix dollars six shilling arising from a bond received from J: Baird, in favor of the bastard Gert Nelse whereof there is a bond under dateJune 6:th 1823
    settled with Fredrik Mong in September 1825 vide liquid: account from Feitje Lubbe /widow/ residing in the, districtor, the sum of nine hundred and thirty three rix dollars, two shillings and two stivers, arising in reduction of the sum of 4000 guilders from the purchase of the loan place thewithin thethe bond of purchase is in hand of the messenger Frederick Moncke, district
    erfgen:174 rd: 4 from Hendrick Lubbe, Roedolfs son, resideing within the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, district, the sum of one hundred and seventy four rix dollars and four schillings, arising from an advance on expences due the messenger, which was discharged by bond of the deceased whereof there are two receipts of the messenger Fuge bearing dateApril 17:th 1822
    Debts of the estate
    paid bij the acting Agent to David de Koker s:r residing within the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, district, the sum of thirteen rix dollars arising from payment of the deceased opgaff of last year of which there is no bond
    bewys rd:144 to Samuel Fuge, messenger, the sum of one hundred and seventy four rix dollars and four shillings arising from money advanced for Hendrick Lubbe, r:s for which there is a bond, bearing date17:th April 1823 transfered in favor of John Baird
    settled with the acting Agent to John Baird disctrict, the sum of sixty three rix dollars and six schillings, arising from a bond delivered to the burger Gideon Rudolf Lubbe R: which was against himself and in favor of the bastard Gert Nelse whereof there is a bond bearing date June 6:th 1823
    settled with the acting agent to John Baird, district, the sum of one hundred rix dollars arising from an advance on the provisional purchase of the female slave Spaas and her child little Spaas which was afterwards nul and void whereof there is a bond, bearing date March 8:th 1822
      to John Baird, district, the sum of ten rix dollars arising from an advance on accounts of a memorial to Government for the regestry of his the deceased slaves , whereof there is a bond, bearing dateJune 6:th 1823
    settled with the acting Agent to John Baird districtthe sum of one rix dollar one schilling and two stivers, arising from an advance to the Government reply of the memorial bearing date Colonial Office, June 27:th 1823 whereof there is no bond
    paid bij the acting Agent to John Andries Broadrick residing within the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, district, the sum of twenty five rix dollars for the coffin for the deceased whereof there is a bill, bearing dateJuly 14:th 1823 signed D:S: Forie field cornet
    paid bij the acting Agent to Peter Daniel Jacobs residing within the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie district, the sum of nineteen rix dollars arising from boards delivered for the coffin and an advance of rix dollars eight for the bearers of the corps to the grave whereof there is a bill, bearing dateJuly 14:th 1823 signed D:S: Forie field cornet
    paid bij the Orphan Chamber in March 1825 to Jan Jankwitz residing in the Cape district the sum of forty seven rix dollars arising from goods bought whereof there is a bill, bearing date Oct:r 8:th 1821
      to Martice Forie residing within the field cornetship of David Stephanus Forie, district, the sum of three rix dollars arising from the purchase of a roll of tobacco whereof there is no bond
    Heirs of the estate
    Hendrick Lubbe Roedolfs son aged about 42 years, born Aug:t 14:th 1781
    Maria Catrena Lubbe, Roedolfs daughter, married with Hendrick Albertus Bukus
    Gideon Rudolf Lubbe, Roedolf son, aged 33 years born May 22:nd 1790
    Adrian Ludewick Lubbe Roedolfs son, aged 31 years, born in May or June 1792
    Jan Ludewick Lubbe Roedolfs son, married with Margaretha Magdelena Elizabeth de Koker Davids daughter

    Thus done and regestered atMonday Sept:r 22:nd 1823 according to the statement of Gideon Lubbe Roedolfs son and Jan Ludewick Lubbe Roedolfs son, who declare in their above statement of this estate having been done honestly and truly and that nothing has been held back to the best of their knowledge and that they further declare, they are always ready if called upon to solemnise the same by oath and they further promise in the event of anything further coming to their recollection or knowlegde, to bind themselves to add the same to this inventory.

    And this done by me the undersigned Dep:y Landdrost, in presence of Joseph Cleaver and Peter Stockenstrom as witnesses

    For the statement: Gideon Roedolf Lubbe, Jan Lodewijk Lubbe

    As witnesses: Joseph Cleaver, P: Stockenstrom

    J: Baird, D:y Land:t

    Ampliatie

    Heden den 15 Maart 1824 wierd door H:A: Beukes in huwelyk hebbende Maria Catharina Lubbe en door Adriaan Lodewyk Lubbe alhier opgaaf gedaan, dat tegen aan hun voor moederlyke erffenis is bevoegen volgens acte van tauxatie ter Weeskamer op den 3:de Maart 1809 gepasseerd, bedragende aandeel rd:286:15, nog niet hadden ontvangen in dezelve mits dien uit den boedel van hun overleden vader kwamen te vorderen met de renten indien het aan hunnen broeder vermaakt legaat effect resteerden genegen zynde dese hunne opgaaf (des vereischt) met eede gestand te doen.

    Weeskamer 15 Maart 1824

    Hendrik Albertus Beukes H: zoon

    Aderaan Lodewijk Lubben

    MOOC8/44.13¶

    {18231020} 20 October 1823 Paulus Johannes Hartog

    Extract rekening des boedels van wylen de heer Paulus Johannes Hartog senior overleden teop den 20:e OCtober 1823

      Rd:s Rd:s
    liquidatie rekening tusschen den boedel van wylen Paulus Johannes Hartog en deszelfs minderjarige zoon Philip Hendrik in huwelyk verwekt by Geertruida Johanna Wilhelmina Snibbe
    deszelfs erfportie bedraagd volgens boedel reek: 76 part van het batig saldo   3236:7:2
    in voldoening daarvan word hem toe en aanbedeeld
    de slaaf Alexander aan hem gelegateerd blykens testament voor 1500:--:--
    betaald voor t transport van dezelve 10:2:--
    een schepen kennis tot lasten van Joh:s Hartog waarvan de renten ingegaan zyn den 1:e January 1825 1726:5:2
    Komt als boven Rd:s3236:7:2

    Accordeert: A: Blommenstein

    Heirs
    the deceased mother Geertruyda Joh:a Snible remarried with Joh:s Jac:s Gering and
    the brother Paul Joh:s Hartog Paulz:n (senior)

    MOOC8/4.14¶

    {18280616} 16 June 1828 Johanna Maria Janzen

    Exh:d the 25:th of June 1828, n:o 35

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Johanna Maria Janzen wid: Johannes Mattheus on the 16 day of the month of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty eight in favor of her only minor son Josephus Mattheus begotten in lawful marriage by her aforesaid late husband.

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters was found to consist in the following

    In a house of Mr Marth:s Horst

    a ward robe containing
    twenty five petty coats
    thirteen spencers
    two p:r of staves
    seven shifts
    four caps
    five frils
    nine handkerchief
    two shawls
    four towels
    seven p:r of stockens
    a p: of silk gloves
    three bonnets
    some ruben and lace
    four necklaces
    a gold ring
    a snuf box
    four small paper boxes
    five fans
    two combs
    eighteen forks
    three knives
    seven spoons
    two looking glasses
    fifteen pictures
    a p: of scales and beam
    a pestel and mortar
    four chairs
    a table
    a tea urn copper
    a coffy pot
    two tea spoons
    fifteen plates and dishes in sort
    twelve glasses in sort
    two defective decanters
    two jugs
    some empty bottels and flasks
    some earthen jars and
    some rubbish
    a set of bed curtains
    ten pieces of different coin

    Thus inventoried in Cape Town o the 16 June 1828 according to a statement made by Joacqui Hopes who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid. And the appearer further declared that he is willing and ready at all times if required, to confirm his aforesaid statement by solemn oath if required promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property belonging to the aforesaid might be discovered will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber order to ampify the inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof I the undersigned together with the appearer have subscribed to these presents

    As witness: Tho: Read Welch

    Joaquis Lopez

    In my presence: R: v: Breda, Clerk

    List of all such property as had been left at the demise of Johanna Maria Janzen widow of the late Johannes Matheus, and which was forgotten to be given up on the taking of the inventory of the 16:th June 1825

    One case containing
    one blue cloth pillisse
    four petticoats
    three spencer
    one shawl
    two bonetts
    two p:r of stays
    ten caps
    four handkerchiefs /sorts/
    one jalousie mat
    one portable desk
    three p:r shoes
    one small table
    five p:r stockings

    Inventoried by me the undersigned as given up by Joque Hopes June 17:th 1828

    Witness: the mark + of Joseph Merlor

    Tho: Read Welch

    Joaquim Lopez

    Exhib: 12 March 1828 n: 19

The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of his unknown heirs and been inventoried by the undersigned was found to consist in the following, viz:

    At the house of the widow Steidler

    a ramnent of quils
    a few pencils and toys
    a blanked
    some marking instruments
    ten gews harps
    ten shirts
    eight p:r of trowsers
    four waistcoats
    three jackets

    five p:r of stockens

    two large chest
    five empty casks
    a pistol
    a small table

    The deceased house keeper state that the cash which was in the estate has been used by her for three months house rent up to the 29 instant being r:105 and for paying a note due a the 24 inst: a favor of claims to the amount of rd:s170

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope in the house aforesaid o the 28 Feb:y 1828 according to a statement made by Sara Elizabeth Smith, this house keeper, who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of her knowledge she has not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate and the said appearer further declared that she is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm her statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of the estate might be discovered shall and will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof I the Commissioner with the appearer and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commisioner: J: Brand

    Mark of + Sara Eliz:h Smith

    In my presence: J:J:L: Smuts

    {18270109} 9 January 1827 Biorn Magnussen

    Inventory of the property of Biorn Magnussen relinquished by his death on the fourth day of the month of January in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven at a quarter past six oclock p:m:

    The deceased having by his last will and testament executed before the Notary Public Willem Adrian Wentzel and witnesses on the 30:th December 1826 instituted and appointed as his sole and universal heirs his brothers and sisters or their descendants. And further by his aforesaid will and testament requested and appointed the worshipful Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony to be and to act as his executors.

    In consequence of which the aforesaid property (after the seals of office had been removed) was duly inventoried by the undersigned special Commissioners from the Orphan Board and was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    A house and premises situated in Cape Town in the rowas per deed of transfer made to the deceased on the 21:st November 1817

    In a store belonging to Mrs the widow Joh:s Krynauw possessed by the deceased on rent

    one bureau containing
    a watch supposed to be gold with a gold seal
    a silver watch
    a silver sugar box
    a silver snufbox
    two silver table spoons
    two silver forks
    four silver sweetmeat forks
    four silver tea spoons
    a small gold finger ring
    a watch stand
    a bedstead with two feather beds, eight pillows and one bolster
    a writing desk containing
    nine p:r of stockings
    six shirts
    four waistcoats
    one great coat
    one p:r of cloth trowsers
    two p:r Nankein trowsers
    one linnen table cloth
    two pocket handkerchiefs
    four neck handkerchiefs
    one case of razors

    in copper coin nine pence halfpenny sterling
    Claims in favor of the estate
        Rd:s
    paid interest up to the 26 July last in part of the capital rd:666:32 with the interest thereon, 23 Aug:t 1827 from Ryno Mellet as per notarial bond dated 26 July 1824 bearing interest at the rate of 1/2 per cent per month 2000:-- 150:--:--
    In geschrifte aangenomen op ult: Juny te betalen 22 M:t 1827; paid the balance of this capital 20 August 1827 from Joh:s Hendrik Vuurman as per notarial bond dated 2:d of September 1818 1000:-- 75:--:-- paid in part of this capital r:500 with the interest from 2 Sep: 1826 up to this day 29 May 1827
      with the interest at 1/2 per cent per month from 2 September 1826
      from Christiaan Frieslew as per note of hand dated 15 August 1823 30:-- 2:5:--
      from William Stringer as per note of hand dated 15 Decb:r 1825 280:-- 21:--:--
      from Christoffel Schneegans as per bill 31:-- 2:6:6:
      from Willem Nielsen as per bill 21:-- 1:11:6
      from Hendrik Emanuel Blanckenberg as per bill 9:36 0:14:7 1/2
      from William Stringer as per bill dated 14 Decb:r 1824 per balance 20:6 1:10:2 1/4
      from William Stringer as per bill dated 3 May 1825 81:12 6:1:10 1/2
      from William Stringer as per bill dated 15 June 1825 20:-- 1:10
      from Kasje Claasen Dekenah as per bill dated 11 February 1826 20:36 1:11:1 1/2
      from Washington per balance of acc:t as per bill 36:-- 2:14:--
      from David Hendrik Mellet as per bill dated the 4:th June 1824 4:-- 0:6:--
      from C: Lezar as per three bills amounting together to 72:-- 5:8:--
    sequester 22 March 1827 from the late Isaak Lezar whose estate is at present administered by the Sequestrator as per private bond dated 13:th of October 1825 514:-- 38:11:--
      from Pieter Pietersen for three months houserent reckoned from the 1 October till the 31 December 1826 at the rate of 50 rd:s per month 150:-- 11:5:--

    Thus inventoried at the Cape of Good Hope in the store aforesaid on the ninth day of the month of January in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty seven according to a statement made by Hans Pietersen who declared to have acted herein bona fide and that to the best ot his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate and the appearer further declared that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement by solemn oath if required, promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall and will faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify the inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof we the Commissioners together with the appearer and the Secretary have subscribed to these presents.

    As Commissioners: J:F: Munnik, J: Horne

    Hans Petersen

    In my presence: G:A: Watermeyer

    MOOC8/44.18¶

    {18270918} 18 September 1827 Willem Andries Pretorius Anna Sophia Putter

    Inventaris van alle zodanige goederen en effecten als er door wylen Willem Andries Pretorius en mede wylen deszelfs huisvrouw Anna Sophia Putter in gemeenschap bezeten en door eerstgem: ab in testato met er dood ontruimd op den 10 October 1826 en nagelaten, mitsgaders op hede opgenomen en bevonden te bestaan in

    een oude bed
    twee katels
    een bakkist
    drie emmers
    twee balies
    een vyssel
    een groote Bybel
    drie tavels
    een groote Bybel
    drie tavels
    een kelder met 10 vlessen
    twee stooven
    twee aarde potten
    drie aarde kannen
    een blikke [kannen]
    een zadel
    een klyne kistje
    twee strykyzer
    seven boeken
    drie schotels
    een pot
    een ketel
    een drievoet
    een potlepel
    een fork
    een kastrol
    een rooster
    een vaatje
    vier bakken
    een schaal en balans
    een zaag
    een zaag /klyn/
    een dissel hand byl
    drie booren
    een byl
    2 schoorsteen ketings
    een mandje
    een lantaarn
    een roskam
    een yzer
    drie silver lepels
    twee silver forken
    een horologie
    een zoeplepel
    een kom
    een schuifdoosje
    een geld boekje
    een zoepkom
    een schenkblad
    een ketel
    een trekpotje
    een zift
    twee trommels
    twee blakers
    een snuiter en bakje
    een koffymolen
    een kan
    een theemachine
    een koffykan
    een lampet
    ses messen
    ses forken
    ses lepels
    een spiegel
    twaalf borden /in zoort/
    drie pierings
    vier kopjes
    een bottel
    drie kannetjes
    een wagenkist
    een zommereel
    vyf stoelen
    een ploegschaar, hoepels en duigen
    twee paarde wagen /een oud/
    een oude osse wagen
    een jas
    drie baatjes
    een rok
    drie pakken klederen /compleet/
    een combaay en hoed
    Beestiaal
    agtien ossen
    seventien beesten
    twee honderd een en twintig lammerschapen
    twee honderd vyf en vyftig aanteel schapen
    seventien paarden
    Slaven
    den slaaf Adam
    den slaaf Amsterdam
    de slavin Cornelia
    den slaaf Fortuin /overleden/
    de slavin Roslet by Philippus Petrus Minnaar P: zoon woonagtig aan de
    Baten des boedels
      Rd:s
    van Isaac Visagie // bl: bewys d:d: 12 July 1824 43:--
    van de wed: Jan A: Olivier,, bl: brief d:d: 11 August 1826 302:6
    Schulden des boedels
        Rd:s
      aan Andries Lod: Pretorius bl: reekning 303:1:5
      aan Paul Maree voor een merrie paard bl: brief d:d: 17 Mei 1827 30:--:--
      aan M:J: Pretorius bl: reekn:g 42:--:--
      aan M:J: Pretorius bl: reekn:g 70:--:--
    paid 18 Sept: 1829 aan P: Heugh and Co: bl: reekning 76:7:--
    paid 15 Septem: 1829 aan S: Stronk bl: reekning 200:--:--
    paid 14 Aug:t 1828 aan Gerh: P: Pretorius G: zoon bl: reekning 129:--:--
      aan den veld c:t Pienaar bl: reekning 30:--:--
      aan Diedrik Hatting bl: brief d:d: 17 January 1827 33:4:--
      aan J:A: de Wit bl: reekning 9:--:--

    Erfgenamen des boedels zo verre den opgeever bekend is vide lyst op den 7 Feb:y 1827 naar den Weeskamer gezonden.

    Aldus gedaan en geinventariseerd op den 18 September 1827 volgens op en aangave van A:L: Pretorius dewelke betuige zig in het op en aangeeven des voormelden boedels ter goeder trouwe te hebben gedragen en niets met weten verswegen of agtergehouden te hebben alles doende onder aanbod van eede met al verder belofte zo zich iets nader tot den boedel behorende mogte komen te ontdekken deezen inventaris daarmede te zullen amplieeren ende is zulks geschied door my ond:e Agent der Weeskamer ter presentie van J:J: Meintjes en G:J: Broekhuizen.

    Voor d opgaave: Andries Lodeweijk Pretorius

    Als getuigen: J:J Meintjes, G:J: Broekhuisen

    J:L: Meintjes

    MOOC8/44.19¶

    {18181110} 10 November 1818 Kilpatrick Colley

    Lyst van de goederen van den overleeden Kilpatrick Colley door ondergeteekenden op de plaatz van G: Joubert den oude opgenomen den 10 November 1818, als volgd

    een hoed
    een jakket
    drie onderbaadjes
    vier broeken
    een hembd
    vier doeken
    twee paar koussen
    een p:r schoenen
    een hamer
    een waterpas
    een droffel
    een schiet lood
    vier wryfplanken en
    een merrie rypaard

    Gedaanden 10 November 1818

    Getuygen: Willem Jordaan, J: Bruwer

    A:J: van Coller, Vld cornet

    MOOC8/44.20¶

    {18241230} 30 December 1824 Willem August

    Inventaris ter nalatenschap van den ongedoopten bastaard Willem August, overleden ab intestato op den 15 December 1824 ter plaatse van Paul And:s Mouton aan dein den ouderdom van /naar gissing/ 60 jaren

    16 aanfok beesten
    4 ossen
    3 rypaarden
    1 ryzadel en toom
    1 pakzadel
    1 ploegschaar
    1 ongemaakte wagen as
    1 wagen /:geheel en al defect:/
    1 kar
    5 jokken
    garst, naar gissing 250 garven
    koren van omtrent een mud zaad nog onafgesneden staande
    Lasten des boedels
      Rd:s
    aan Hendrik Schalk Burger sen:r over koop van n paard 15
    aan Willem Burger Schalkz:n over koop van n paard 15
    aan den slaaf Silvester leyfeigen van Gideon Joubert over koop van n paard 30
    aan Willem Burger Fred:kz over negotie goederen 92
    aan den vryzwart Jan Rosemond van de Kaap over negotie 50
    aan Jacob Thiard over 8 mud zout 32
    aan Nic:s Ev:s Lambrechts over drank 5
    aan Willem Henning over een stuk linnen 10
    aan Christ:n Liebenberg jun:r over een zadel per rest debet 7
    aan Izaak August over zes mudden koren 60
    Bate des boedels
      Rd:s
    van Jacobus van Wyk woonachtig opwegens negotie goederen 100

    Aldus deze inventaris geformeerd ter plaatse van Paul And:s Mouton gelegen aan deop den 30 December 1824 en zulks naar aan en opgave van des overledenen byzet de slavin Rachel en des overledenen broeder de bastaard Izaak August

    Als getuigen: H: Winterbach, B:T: Burger

    J:G: Aspelingh, Ag:t van H:H: Wm:

    MOOC8/44.21¶

    {18280528} 28 My 1828 Carolus

    Lyst van de nagelaaten eygendommen van wylen den Hottentot Carolus dien overleeden is den maandt My laastleeden den 28:ste 1828 en dienst geweest zynde by den burger Hendrik Jacobus van Heerden en by gemelden is gestoven, waar op ik met de twee onderstaande getuijgen het vhee behoorlyk heef geteld en op geteekend en volgens opgaaf van de getuijgen is niet bekend dat den overleedenen eenig familie of maagschap heef nagelaaten, als meede

    reunderen 12
    schapen 14
    bokken 17

    Getuijgen: Hendrik Jacobus van Heerden, Jacobus Johannes van Heerden

    C:F: van der West, Veld cornet

    MOOC8/44.23a¶

    {18260123} 23 January 1826 Candas

    Extract journal held by the dep:ty Landdrost ofon Tuesday Jan:y 23 1826

    The Hott:t Hend:k Blaauw appeared and stated that he has brought the remaining property of the estate of the deceased female Hottentot Candas with whose daughter Lys he cohabits with and the property is as follows

    12 sheep
    5 goats
    1 hand ax
    1 small cooking pot

    the rest having died and eaten op thro poverty

    Questions
    1 1
    Yes, but of which 14 died from poverty, 11 we eat for our support and 1 died on the road coming here with those for sale Did you not receive on account of your maid Lys 64 sheep and goats as stated by the bastard Plaatje Kock on the 17:th Nov:r last, if so what became of them
    2 2
    I do not know, they must have been lost by my children who herded them without my knowledge, I cannot count, read or write and am often from home What is become of the remaining number
    3 3
    Yes Is those two or three which Plaatje Kock had, included
    4 4
    She left some time ago fornear the, but I now understand that she is gone toto her husband What is become of the female Hottentot Truy, your maids sister
    5 5
    They lived upon them and before she leftthey had not one to eat What is become of the sheep and goats she received

    The female Hottentot Lys appears or requisition and coroborates the statement of the Hottentot Hend:k Blaauw

    The burger Jan Herm:s Coertz appears on requisition and states that he is also aware that the 20 sheep and goats received by the female Hott:t Truy daughter of the deceased Candas were all used atwhich she Truy was living with the Hottentot Andries Jures then in the service of Adrian van Wyk sen:r of which circumstance the Englishman named Man is also acquainted with. He is now at the, district of, left sick but who is soon expected to return.

    Resolved that an extract hereof do accompany the auction roll of the property sold on account of the late Candas for the information and consideration of the Board of Orphan Masters.

    A true extract: J: Baird, D:y Land:t

    MOOC8/44.23b¶

    {18251117} 17 November 1825 Candas

    Extract from the journal held by the Deputy Landdrost ofon Thursday 17 November 1825

    The bastard Hottentot Platje Kock aged ab:t 60 years and in the service of the burger Jan Herm:s Coertze states that his late wife the female Hottentot Candaas died on the 11 Nov:r 1824 by whom he had no children but she had by her former husband 6 children one of which only is under age and that when she died she left the following property

    120 breeding sheep and goats and
    1 pot
    1 ox
    Questions
    No we were both unbaptized Was you lawfully married with her?
    Danzer d: Hottentot What was the name of her former husband?
    The oldest daughter Lys of my late wife received 64 of the sheep and goats which she has still under her protection I believe. The second oldest daughter Truy received 20 more sheep and goats the rest I have used from time to time and do no suppose there can be more than 3 or 4 left. The ox and pot is also still in my possession. What has become of the property you speak of?

    Resolved that an extract hereof be submitted to the Board of Orphan Masters for information and consideration.

    A true extract: J: Baird, D:y Land:t

    MOOC8/44.24¶

    We the undersigned Robert Godlonton and James Wicks, inhabitants of this town, chosen appraisers for the intestate estate of the late Benjamin Brown do hereby make oath and declare that the foregoing estimate is to the best of our knowledge and belief a just and proper valuation.20:th Sepb:r 1828

    Sworn before me atthe 26:th of Sept:r 1828

    Dan: Campbell, J:P: forand

    R: Godlonton

    Ja:s Weeks

    MOOC8/44.25¶

    {18290203} 3 February 1829 Alexander Corlette

    Exh:d the 4 February 1829, n:o 16

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death ab intestato of Alexander Corlette on the second day of the month of February in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty nine for the benefit of his unknown foreign heirs.

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of his aforesaid heirs and been inventoried by me the undersigned and was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    In the house in, occupied by George Sibbald

    one stretcher
    a bed
    two pillows
    one blancket
    one sheet
    three tables
    three chairs
    a clothes horse
    a rack
    a small box containing two knives
    a writing desk, containing
    nine shells
    two brushes
    one comb
    one looking glass
    two small pictures
    a wash hand bason and jug
    a small kettle
    a bucket
    a chamber pot
    a chest, containing
    three shirts
    two waistcoats
    five handkerchiefs
    one white p:r of trowsers
    two p:r of stockings
    one p:r black trowsers
    one frockcoat
    one black coat
    one towel
    one pillowcase
    one pair gloves
    a quantity of books
    some old cloaths
    a pair boots
    a boatjack
    five window glasses
    one knife and fork
    one wine glass and a saucer
    a shaving box
    one gold pin
    a glaziers diamon
    a hat
    Claim in favor of the estate
      Rd:s
    from Mr Pope for work done 17

    Thus inventoried in Cape Town on the 3:d day of the month of February 1829 according to a statement made by George Sibbald, who declared to have acted herein bonafide and that to the best of his knowledge he has not withheld or secreted any thing that belonged to the aforesaid estate and the said appearer further declared that he is and will at all times be ready and willing to confirm his statement with solemn oath if required promising at the same time that if after the date of these presents any property of this estate might be discovered shall faithfully communicate it to the Orphan Chamber in order to amplify this inventory with the property so discovered.

    In witness whereof I the undersigned together with the appearer have subscribed to these presents

    As witness: P: Macdougal

    George Sibbald

    In my presence: J:A: Munnik

    MOOC8/44.26¶

    {18290527} 27 May 1829 Johanna Francina Appel

    Inventory of all such goods and effects as have been possessed by the late Johanna Francina Appel widow of the late Jacob Erasmus born in this Colony died on the 16 January 1829 at the place calledin the fieldcornetry, district, aged 44 years

    one old ox waggon
    eight yokes
    eight reams and ropes
    one gun
    two bedsteads
    three buckets
    two casks
    three iron pots
    one chain
    one bed, 2 pellows and blanket
    two footstools
    two kettles and one chafing dish
    eight plates
    eight spoons and five forks
    one candlestick and snuffer
    one dish
    one bottle
    one jar
    one chest
    one Bible and one sermon book
    Cattle
    one saddle horse
    six oxen
    two breeding cattle
    one hundred and eighteen goats
    Credits
    none
    Debts
      Rd:s
    to Petrus Abraham Erasmus for money borrowed 135:5
    to Josua Joubert for merchandize 29:--
    to Dr Perry for medicines 12:--
      Rd:s176:5
    Heirs
    1) Petrus Abraham Erasmus born 19 December 1802
    2) Catharina Sophia married to Johannes Jacobus Grobbelaar J:s son
    3) Anna Maria married to Barend Nicolaas Janzen
    4) Jacobus Johannes born 3 January 1809
    5) Hendrik Ferdinandus born 19 May 1813
    6) Jacob Fredrik born 26 October 1816
    7) Maria Wilhelmina born 11 March 1821
    8) Johanna Fredrica born 11 November 1818
    9) Johannes Petrus Nicolaas born 23 July 1823

    Thus done and inventoried at the placesituated in the fieldcornetryon the 27 day of May 1829 according to the declaration of Barend Nicolaas Janzen, who declared that to the best of his knowledge he has given up all the effects that belong to the estate of the late Johanna Francina Appel widow of the late Jacob Erasmus with further promise should any thing be found afterwards to add it to this inventory for all which he offered to make oath if required. Thus done in the presence of the undersigned witnesses.

    Baarent Nicolaas Jansen

    As witnesses: G:J: Broekhuisen, C:A: Brink, V:d c:t

    MOOC8/44.27¶

    {18290425} 25 April 1829 Christina Jacoba van Zijl

    Inventaris des boedels van Christina Jacoba van Zijl ter plaatzein het districtgelegen, geboren op den 12 Augustus 1792 ter plaatze, gelegen in het districtin den ouderdom van 36 jaren 7 maanden en 7 dagen overleeden nalatende haren echtgenoot Joseph Bensch en vyf onmondige kinderen, in namen

    1) Johannis Augustus Esterhuysen geboren in de maand December 1815
    2) Johanna Aletta Maria Bensch geboren den 11 January 1821
    3) Jacobus Johannis Cornelis Bensch geb: den 22:ste Augustus 1822
    4) Maria Bensch geboren den 6 Augustus 1824 ongedoopt
    5) Christina Jacoba Bensch geboren den 22:ste Augustus 1826

    Welke inventaris door mij Aldert Hermias Cornelis van Zijl ten overstaan van de getuigen H:n N:s van Rhyn en Joh:s D:d van Zijl is geformeerd in wel ingevolge opgaaf van voorzeide Joseph Bensch, die de volgende opgaaf heeft gedaan te weten

    drie en zestig aanteel schapen
    een en veertig bokken
    3 1/2 mud koorn
    een oude kist
    1 hang slot met zyn sleutel
    2 yzer kook potten
    1 koper kook ketel defect
    1 mes en 2 vorkens
    4 tinne lepels defect
    3 houte kokers ofte bamboezen
    2 oude stoelen defect
    1 oude bed
    2 schaap vellen combaarssen
    1 oude Huisbybel bevattende Oude en Nieuwe Testament
    1 boek, Beschryving van Joseph
    1 kleine predikatie boekje
    1 Nieuwe Evangelische gezangboekje
    1 Korte begrip met uitleggers
    wat oude vrouw klederen reeds kleinder vermaak tot gebruik van voornoemde kinderen

    Aldus geinventariseerd ter plaatzegelegen in de wyk, districtop den 25:ste April 1829.

    Voor de opgaaf: J: Bensch

    A:H:C: van Zijl, Veld cornet

    Als getuigen: H: van Rhijn. J:D: van Zyl

    MOOC8/44.28¶

    {18300105} 5 January 1830 Benjamin Blyth

    Copy

    Inventaris van Benjamin Blyth overleden den 6 January 1830 op den plaats van de heer Hend: Corn:s van Niekerk aan, als volgt

    bureau defect
    een zilvere zak horologie
    een paard met zadel en toom
    een gieter
    een schaar, een pennemes, een knipmes en een bril
    drie borstels
    in een van de bureau laatjes eenige brieven en papieren beneevens een schelling koper geld
    in een ander laadje een scheermes, een stryk yser en een party tuin zaak en zakjes
    in een andere laadje, een klyne borstel, twee tande borseltjes, een kammetje, een scheerdoosje, en een griffie
    in een andere laatje, 4 klyne kannetjes, drie flesjes en een blikke doosje
    in twee andere laadjes, een olie steen beneevens een weinig rommelinge
    een trommeltje met wat garen en een doosje met een schaartje
    28 boeken in zoort
    een blikje met een weinig kruid en een zak met wat hagel
    een inkdoosje en drie tinne inkpotjes
    een klisteerspuitje
    een spiegel doos
    2 hoeden
    een bruine boven baatje
    twee zwarte onderbaatjes
    een geele casimiere onderbaatje
    een bruine lakense boven baatje
    een zwarte jek
    een bombarzyne jek
    een dufse boven baatje
    een wolle bovenbaatje
    twee lange casimiere broeken
    een bombarzyne lange broek
    twee paar handschoenen
    twintig doeken in zoort
    5 hembden
    4 paar koussen
    een kruysband
    5 paar schoenen en een paar oude stevels
    nog een Vlaamslinn: lange broek
    een wit gekeeperde lange broek
    vier paar koussen en vyf hembden

    Nagezien en in zyn schoolvertrek gevonden den 5 January 1830

    /get:d/ H:C: van Niekerk M:z:, A:s Brink A:z, H:J: Mellet

    MOOC8/44.29¶

    {18290630} 30 June 1829 Carolus of Madagascar

    Exh:d the 1 July 1829, n:o 17

    Inventory of all such property as has been relinquished by the death of Carolus of Madagascar on the 8:th day of the month of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and twenty nine for the benefit of his two minor children named Soente and Salea , both slaves of D:G: Aspeling.

    The aforesaid property having been taken under the administration of the Board of Orphan Masters of this Colony in behalf of the said two minor children and been inventoried by the undersigned and was found to consist in the following, viz:t

    In the house of J: M:cDonaldand in the back room

    one stretcher

    one cloth jacket

    1 handkerchief
    1 empty cupboard
    1 watercask
    2 curtains
    1 iron pot
    1 lanthern
    some crockery ware
    1 table and 1 chair

    Thus inventoried at the aforesaid place on the 30:th of June 1829 according to a statement of the wife of J: M:cDonald who has declared to have stated every thing to the best of her knowledge and belief

    For the statement: Aaron M:cDonald

    In my presence: J:P: Berrang

    MOOC8/44.30¶
